Caption: Microplastics are EVERYWHERE.They’ve been found in food water our bodies and even in clouds…Scientists are only beginning to understand the long-term effects of plastic on human health but one thing is clear: the only way to stop microplastic pollution is to cut plastic production at the source.Tell world leaders: We need a strong ambitious Global #PlasticsTreaty NOW!Tap the link in our bio to sign the petition! ✍️#breakfreefromplastic #microplastics #plastic #memes #climatecrisis #plasticpollution #realsolutions #plasticfree #zerowaste #reuse #refill

REMINDER: There is NO safe way to transport oil and gas.When oil companies drill they spill.Yesterday a monumental collision between a cargo ship and an oil tanker occurred in the North Sea—bad news for the sea wildlife and air around it. What we don’t yet know is just how bad it will be.Fossil fuel explosions collisions leaks and fires are poisoning our air land and seas. It’s impossible to fully clean up an oil spill and ecosystems never completely recover.While greedy corporations and billionaire CEOs line their pockets they endanger workers push up household costs and destroy the ecosystems life depends on.It’s time to hold them to account and make them pay for the damage they’ve done.Take action via the link in our bio @‌greenpeace#StopDrillingStartPaying #shipcollision #stenaimmaculate #solong #northsea #fuelspill #oilspills #climatecrisis #biodiversitycrisis #marinelife #pollution

The death toll continues to rise after the worst flash floods in three decades swept through Spains Valencia region.More than 100 people have already lost their lives and dozens in eastern and southern Spain remain missing.The images barely capture the overwhelming grief for the lives lost but they reveal the scale of this unfolding tragedy in homes cities and communities around the world.As greenpeace_esp comrades say: when we talk about the climate crisis it often feels abstract distant from our everyday lives. But climate change is right here with extreme weather events like this one bringing escalating devastation. Turning a blind eye isn’t just risky—it costs lives.Amor y solidaridad to all people who are affected by extreme weather events in Spain and elsewhere in the world 💔​It’s time to #MakePollutersPay and take serious measures to protect people against extreme weather events. Fossil fuel companies driving climate chaos must #StopDrillingStartPaying.📸​: greenpeace_esp © Greenpeace / Gabriel Gallo#spain #españa #valencia #floods #flashfloods #extremeweather #climatecrisis #livesbeforeprofits

Stop scrolling‼️ Take a moment to watch this. To really watch it. Forget about borders. Forget about your ideologies your conspiracy theories. Forget about your in groups and your out groups.⁣⁣Just watch the water rise. Listen to the wind.⁣⁣Think about what it would feel like to try to flee from this – and how it would feel to be overwhelmed by it.⁣⁣Who would you lose? Family members? Friends? Pets? Beloved spaces you grew up in are attached to?⁣⁣Your life?⁣⁣This climate boiled monster of a hurricane that made meteorologists CRY on live TV is happening on our planet to human beings and animals and ecosystems.⁣⁣And there are very. clear. reasons. for. it. None of which have to do with weather modification machines – unless by that you’re referring to oil rigs or clear cut mass cattle ranches or plastic production factories etc etc…⁣⁣People are losing their lives their loved ones and their homes.⁣⁣How many more times are we going to let this happen?⁣⁣This is your planet. These are your neighbours.⁣⁣The fossil fuel companies the billionaires and the politicians who snuggle up to them are taking it all away.⁣⁣On a scale of 1 to revolution how mad does it make you?⁣⁣It’s time to let our anger boil over with the same force as this storm.⁣⁣We are many. They are few. Never forget.⁣⁣#StopDrillingStartPaying ⁣⁣via greenpeace_canada⁣🎥 max_olson_chasing (Note: This is footage from Hurricane Ian 2022) ⁣#MakePollutersPay #PayUp #ClimateCrisis #ClimateEmergency #HurricaneIan #Hurricane #Florida ⁣

This is CLIMATE DENIAL.⁣⁣Soon-to-be-President Trump thinks climate change isn’t our problem for one simple reason — he’s funded by the same people causing it.⁣⁣Because this is what climate change looks like. And it’s brought to you by Oil giants like Shell.⁣⁣Fossil fuels account for over 75% of global greenhouse gas emissions. Drilling and burning these fuels heats our planet which means less rain in summer dryer lands and stronger winds in winter — and more days like this in California and around the world.⁣⁣Enough is enough.⁣⁣We must demand that governments put people and the planet before the profits of big polluters >> LINK IN BIO greenpeace⁣⁣Our hearts go out to the people animals and ecosystems affected by these devastating wildfires and worsening extreme weather around the world ❤️‍🩹. ⁣⁣Let’s #MakePollutersPay for the climate loss and damage they’ve caused.⁣⁣#StopDrillingStartPaying⁣

As the planet burns and the rich grow richer the link between inequality and environmental destruction becomes undeniable.⁣⁣Billionaires emit more carbon pollution in 90 minutes than the average person does in a lifetime.⁣⁣“The super-rich are treating our planet like their personal playground setting it ablaze for pleasure and profit. Their dirty investments and luxury toys —private jets and yachts— aren’t just symbols of excess they’re a direct threat to people and the planet.” Oxfam International Executive Director Amitabh Behar⁣⁣To save our planet we must tackle the root causes of inequality.⁣⁣There’s enough money for a green and fair world.💚🌍⁣⁣It’s just in the wrong pockets. ⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣Image credits: Fair Start Movement  #TaxTheSuperRich  #FightInequality

Shocking. A recent report reveals global wildlife populations have shrunk by an average of 73% in the past 50 years.⁣⁣Global biodiversity is collapsing - but its not just a threat to wildlife - its a fundamental threat to HUMANITY.⁣⁣⁣A major reason for wildlife loss is habitat destruction and problematic land use by humans. An astronomical amount of land is dedicated to cows (and feeding cows) which feed a small population with big appetites. Huge swaths of suburban and rural land are dedicated to grass lawns that provide nothing to the ecosystem and require toxic chemicals to maintain. All that land was once habitat.⁣⁣⁣Biodiversity is essential to life on earth. We must change the way we use our land in order to bring wildlife back from the brink.⁣⁣⁣We need to make a massive switch to more plant-based diets wherever possible plant native and support habitat restoration!⁣⁣⁣The UN Biodiversity #COP16 currently taking place in Cali Colombia is a critical opportunity to change course on a more global scale and make the radical systemic changes that our planet desperately needs.⁣⁣Tap the link in our Instagram bio to read more and take action⁠⁣⁣⁣#biodiversity #biodiversitycrisis #climatecrisis #ecosystems #COP16Colombia #COP16 ⁣#greenpeace #wildlife #plantbased #vegetarian #vegan #lessmeatlessheat

“Nothing is as powerful as an idea whose time has come.”🎉 The US State of Vermont has passed a groundbreaking ‘Make Polluters Pay’ law.This new law gives the state the power to make big oil pay their fair share for the climate damages they have caused.The 2023 floods alone cost Vermonters over US$ 1 billion. Many are still recovering.🏚️ Without this new Climate Superfund the costs of climate-fuelled extreme weather falls on everyday people.Vermont isn’t alone. 👷 California the fifth largest economy in the world is working on a similar bill. Along with states like New York Massachusetts and Maryland.Vermont’s new law is a HUGE step towards holding polluters accountable and easing the financial burden on communities. Vermont’s climate superfund is a bold move for climate justice that sets a clear precedent for the rest of the world.An additional tax on fossil fuel majors based in the OECD countries could raise $720 billion for loss and damage by the end of the decade. (The Climate Damages Tax report)👉 Join the movement - sign the petition. Link in bio greenpeace#StopDrillingStartPaying

The world has baked for 12 consecutive months with global average temperatures 1.64°C over pre-industrial averages according to the Copernicus Climate Change Service.⁣⁣Floods fires and heat waves have shattered homes claimed lives and ruined people’s health while major oil and gas corporations continue to profit jointly earning US$ 2.8 billion on average every day over the past 50 years. ⁣⁣Fossil fuel corporations amongst the primary contributors to climate change have historically denied climate science and spent billions of US$ to hinder climate action. ⁣⁣Sign the petition to make the oil and gas industry pay for the loss and damage it creates.⁣⁣Link in bio greenpeace#stopdrillingstartpaying ⁣

🔥 In 2024 the Brazilian Amazon lost 17.9 MILLION HECTARES to fire an area larger than Bulgaria and Portugal combined.⁣⁣The Amazon spans nine South American countries and is home to 3 million Indigenous people representing over 390 peoples who speak 240 living languages. It’s not just their home it is also a vital lifeline for all of us and for our planet.⁣⁣We all depend on the Amazon for a liveable future. If we don’t act now we risk losing it forever.⁣⁣Help protect the Amazon 🌍 Go to act.gp/4jlEzFT or tap the link in our Instagram bio to add your voice.⁣⁣#RespectTheAmazon #HarrisonFord #Amazon #IndigenousPeoples #IndigenousRights #climatecrisis #biodiversitycrisis #forestfires

Recycling is a fart in a hurricane - it alone won’t save us.⁠⁣⁠⁣Most plastic isn’t recycled - instead it’s shipped overseas to places like Turkey where its dumped burned or left to rot.⁣⁣Corporations keep churning out more plastic knowing full well we can’t deal with the waste. We need to stop making so much plastic in the first place.⁣⁣Time for real action. Time for a Global #PlasticsTreaty that forces corporations & governments to reduce plastic production instead of just shifting the mess around 🌍⁠⁣⁠⁣Agree? Tap the link in our bio to add your name⁠⁣⁠⁣#plastic #recycling #wastecolonialism #plasticfree #singleuseplastic #plasticpollution #climatecrisis⁠⁣⁠⁣📸 Credits:⁠⁠⁣Image 2: earthlyeducation ⁠⁣Image 3: spellingmistakescostlives⁣⁣via greenpeaceuk

Have you ever imagined a greener São Paulo?With the municipal elections coming up Greenpeace teamed up with jankamensky to show that a cleaner and fairer future for access to the city can become a reality.It may seem like a dream to see the River Tietê once again become a living space in the country’s most populous metropolis.To live this transformation we need efficient public policies that adapt cities to the current climate reality.This power is also in your hands. Research the candidates’ proposals and choose those who have plans to tackle the climate crisis and its unequal impacts. Make a difference!To learn more about the issue download the free #ConfirmaPeloClima Guide. The link is in the bio and story of greenpeacebrasil.Com as eleições municipais se aproximando o Greenpeace colaborou com jankamensky para mostrar que um futuro mais limpo e justo no acesso à cidade pode se tornar realidade.Pode parecer sonho ver o Rio Tietê voltar a ser um espaço de vida dentro da metrópole mais populosa do país.Para vivermos essa transformação precisamos de políticas públicas eficientes que adaptem as cidades para a atual realidade climática.Esse poder está também em suas mãos. Pesquise as propostas dos candidatos e candidatas da sua cidade e escolha quem tem projetos de enfrentamento à crise do clima e aos impactos desiguais. Faça a diferença!Para saber mais sobre o tema baixe gratuitamente o Guia #ConfirmaPeloClima. O link está na bio e no story do greenpeacebrasil

How on Earth is it normal that billionaires grow richer every second while millions struggle to afford food housing and survive climate disasters?Inequality is out of control because our system rewards wealth with more wealth. The rich get richer while the rest are left behind. This isn’t just unfair—it’s a feedback loop driving us toward collapse.We’re told myths to justify this: that wealth trickles down that billionaires are essential that capitalism will lift all boats. But the truth? The system is rigged to keep power where it is.It’s time to disrupt this cycle. Taxing the super-rich isn’t radical—it’s necessary. It’s a way to reduce inequality and fund solutions for poverty climate and environmental crises.The ultra-rich and big polluters must pay.🎨 via greenpeace_canada featuring facts and figures from oxfaminternational’s 2022 Carbon Inequality Kills report.#TaxTheSuperRich #MakePollutersPay #FightInequality #ClimateCrisis #LiveBeforeProfits

We joined when Greenpeace Nordic activists took action against the deep sea mining company Loke Marine Minerals.Loke Marine Minerals wants to mine one of the last untouched ecosystems we have in the world: the Arctic deep sea. We are here to demand a halt on deep sea mining before it’s too late. The Norwegian government should join the call for a moratorium on deep sea mining instead of opening up the fragile Arctic to a destructive industry.The oceans are already in crisis. Climate change overfishing and pollution is pushing the oceans to the brink of collapse. Deep sea mining would bring destruction into one of the last ecosystems that so far has been sheltered from industrial exploitation.Take action and sign the petition to stop deep sea mining before it’s too late.: link in bio!#StopDeepSeaMining #SaveTheArctic #ProtectTheOceans

✊ LEADING. RESISTING. SURVIVING. THRIVING 💜⁣⁣Women are on the frontlines of environmental and social justice—leading movements defending land and water and fighting for their communities. Yet they are among the first to suffer the consequences of climate chaos war and economic injustice.⁣⁣80% of people displaced by climate disasters are women.⁣⁣Women land defenders face increasing violence—2023 saw a surge in attacks against those protecting forests and water.⁣⁣In many countries rising toxic masculinity—fuelled by reckless politicians—threatens hard-won gender rights.⁣⁣While we celebrate progress and call to accelerate action we must recognise the struggle. Women’s leadership in the fight for a just and liveable world must be supported and protected.⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣⁣#IWD #InternationalWomensDay #WomensDay  #IWD2025 #WomensHistoryMonth  #WomensHistoryMonth2025 #ClimateJustice

🚨Fires in Bolivia Paraguay Brazil and Argentina🔥The forest fires unleashed in a large part of the Amazon Paraguay and Bolivia affect the environment people’s health biodiversity and the activities of the population. Particularly our country is affected by the smoke that advances from the north towards the center of the country. Greenpeace condemns the Israeli governments renewal of the attacks on Gaza and the end of the ceasefire.⁣⁣This situation is adding endless suffering to the millions of displaced people in Gaza and adds to the nightmare of dozens of hostages still detained by Hamas and their families.⁣⁣Over the past 15 months the relentless violence has claimed tens of thousands of innocent lives – mostly women and children – and pushed Gaza’s infrastructure to collapse. The blockade of essential resources including food water medicine and fuel has left civilians facing starvation disease and worsening suffering.⁣⁣Greenpeace repeats its call for:⁣O An immediate comprehensive and permanent ceasefire to prevent further loss⁣O The unconditional release of all hostages⁣O The urgent and unhindered delivery of humanitarian aid to the people of Gaza⁣O The unconditional release of all illegally detained civilians⁣O A global embargo on arms sales and transfers that fuel further war crimes⁣O The end of the illegal occupation of Palestine in line with international law⁣⁣International law must be upheld and all parties must return to negotiations that build a just and lasting peace. Greenpeace reiterates its call for a future in which Palestinians and Israelis can live side by side in peace in accordance with UN Security Council resolutions and human rights law.⁣⁣#CeasefireNow⁣⁣

Nature is doing its bit it’s time we did ours. ⁠⁣⁣The UN Biodiversity COP16 on biodiversity started yesterday in Cali Colombia.⁣⁠⁣This comes two years after a historic agreement from world leaders to “halt and reverse” nature loss. ⁠⁣⁠⁣But 80% of countries have failed to submit their plans to achieve this. ⁠⁣⁣Let’s raise our voices and demand that our leaders listen—before it’s too late. ⁣⁣Tap the link in our Instagram bio to read more and take action⁠⁣⁠⁣#biodiversity #biodiversitycrisis #ecosystems #COP16Colombia #COP16 #greenpeace

The world is battling deepening and interlocking polycrises. Record-breaking temperatures extreme weather events and ecosystems on the verge of collapse. Billionaires on their way to being trillionaires exerting more undue influence on our lives.To save our planet we must tackle the root causes of inequality. There’s enough money to solve our social environmental and climate problems. Take deforestation off the menu! ⁣⁣Right now the beef industry in Australia is killing millions of native animals every year including koalas wallabies lizards and birds and McDonald’s is one of Australia’s biggest beef purchasers.⁣⁣GreenpeaceAP is calling on McDonald’s to publicly aim for and achieve conversion and deforestation-free supply chains by 2025 using global best practice definitions which includes protecting important regenerated forest and threatened species habitat.⁣⁣Find out more through link in bio 👆

Norway is the first country who decided to open up its seafloor to deep sea mining. As if that wasn’t bad enough the proposed mining area is in the Arctic !⁣⁣The Arctic is already suffering from the consequences of climate change and it’s under a lot of pressure from the oil industry and the industrial fishing industry. We can’t add one more. Join us and auroramusic to stop deep sea mining ! Email the Norwegian Prime Minister >> link in bio.⁣⁣#StopDeepSeaMining #SaveTheArctic #Aurora #Greenpeace #Arctic

Mining the seabed in the Arctic sounds crazy but it’s exactly what the Norwegian government is planning to do.⁣⁣The Arctic is warming 3-4 times faster than the rest of the world and now its core - the deep sea - is about to be exploited for the mining of minerals.⁣⁣Mining the seabed especially near hydrothermal vents could cause irreversible damage and disrupt the entire ecosystem. The noise from the machines could also threaten dolphins and whales that live in the proposed mining area 😭🐬⁣⁣It’s a crucial time to make some noise against these plans. You can take action against deep sea mining by sending an email to the Norwegian Prime Minister - click on the link in bio.⁣⁣#StopDeepSeaMining ⁣

Greenpeace statement on the ongoing war in #GazaGreenpeace urges that both the Israeli government and Hamas unequivocally agree to support and abide by the UN Security Council Ceasefire resolution (2735) in full. To declare an immediate and permanent #CeasefireNow. We call for the bullets and bombs to be silenced so that the growing voices for peace can be heard.Over 250 days have passed since the horrific events of October 7th saw more than 1200 Israelis killed in a single day at the hands of Hamas. Around 250 people were taken hostage. 120 hostages remain in Gaza.Since that day the horror has been compounded many times over. 37000 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli forces. The majority of Gaza’s 2.3 million people have been forced to flee their homes. Much of Gaza has been reduced to rubble famine and disease are rife nowhere and no one is safe. Sanity and humanity must be restored in the face of this unfolding genocide.Since the outset Greenpeace has supported calls for an immediate and permanent ceasefire. We call on Hamas to immediately release all hostages. We call for the Israeli Government to immediately end the blockades on the supply of food water medicine and fuel to the people of Gaza and release all illegally detained civilians.Swipe left on the post to read the rest of our statement.

The world has lost 5% to 10% of all insect species in the last 150 years. The collapse of insect populations across much of the world is one of the most alarming aspects of the unfolding biodiversity crisis.Around 1 million species now face extinction many within the next few decades.Experts say we are in the midst of a mass extinction – the sixth such major die-off event that scientists have documented in Earth’s history.The UN Biodiversity #COP16 currently taking place in Cali Colombia is a critical opportunity to change course on a more global scale and make the radical systemic changes that our planet desperately needs.⁣⁣Tap the link in our Instagram bio to read more and take action⁠⁣⁣⁣#biodiversity #biodiversitycrisis #climatecrisis #ecosystems #COP16Colombia #COP16 ⁣#greenpeace #insects #extinction #massextinction

“If you are appalled by the violence imposed on one man and not the violence imposed on millions something isn’t right!”— Claudia De la Cruz activistIt’s time to name the 🐘​ in the room: Structural Violence IS violence.🚩​ Denying healthcare is violence.🚩​ Evictions are violence.🚩​ Polluting our air water & food is violence.🚩​ Extreme wealth inequality is violence.Yet within this system structural violence is ignored—because to truly take it seriously would mean acknowledging that our current economic model is built on it.The ultra-rich hoard wealth while billions struggle. Their luxury lifestyles fuel emissions that push the planet closer to collapse. And this system? It has self-reinforcing loops that keep it running—unless we break them.Disrupting inequality is key to stopping this deadly cycle of social and environmental destruction.Say it and say it often: Structural violence is violence. And it’s not ok.via greenpeacecanada#SystemsThinking #InfiniteGrowth #LateStageCapitalism #TaxTheRich #MakePollutersPay #StructuralViolence #ClimateCrisis #ActOnClimate #SocialJustice #Inequality #Poverty #Injustice #Privilege

Basic human kindness 💚🌍⁣.⁣.⁣#Respect #Peace #Equality #Decency #Kindness..Editor’s note: We are witnessing the deliberate weaponisation of the term “woke” by political figures who use it as a blanket label to dismiss calls for justice equity and truth. What began as a term rooted in activism—particularly within Black and Indigenous communities—has been distorted into a derogatory buzzword often used to discredit legitimate movements for social change.At its core it’s a call to action. It’s a symbol of our commitment to challenge injustice and fight for real systemic change. 💚🌍Instead of letting politicians twist it into a weapon let’s reclaim “wokeness” as a badge of honour. Read the full blog by our friends at greenpeace_canada for more: Reclaiming Wokeness and Wokeism: Confronting Political Attacks on Justice and Equity in Canada

We all want our communities to be safe. Last year Shell made USD23.7billion in profit. It was also the hottest year on record for the planet.⁣⁣Fossil fuels are the biggest contributor to the climate crisis that causes communities to push through devastating extreme weather everywhere. ⁣⁣The fossil fuel industry has been aware of the crisis they cause for decades but have hidden the truth and discredited the scientific evidence. The economic cost solely from weather and climate events in 2023 was an estimated USD 301 billion (According to insurers Gallagher Re). Now Fossil fuel companies need to pay the price for the damages they’ve consciously caused. ⁣⁣People families and communities are paying the price while fossil fuel companies are making record profits out of their suffering.⁣⁣Their profit is our loss.⁣⁣Governments must protect our families and communities and make oil companies stop drilling and start paying for the damage they’ve caused and the just and fair transition we need.⁣⁣Tell Shell in the comments below to phase out fossil fuels to make way for a green safe and more just society. #StopDrillingStartPaying⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣Wael Sawan Shell in a retouched image (top). Local resident during the wild fires in Evia Greece. (bottom).⁣⁣Disclaimer: Images of CEOs used in this campaign are staged and doctored for illustrative purposes. Illustrations are created without the use of regenerative AI.

The #Paris2024 crowd is feeling the heat as this years #Olympics could be the hottest ever. 🥵🥵 Ironically lead sponsor Toyota boasts the highest carbon emissions among all sponsors according to the New Weather Institute.Reportedly 98% of the cars Toyota sells today still run on fossil fuels. 14 athletes have signed an open letter requesting the Olympic Committee replace Toyota with a true EV leader. Additionally 120 scientists have asked to drop Toyotas hydrogen Mirai as the official vehicle of the Games given that 96% of the world’s hydrogen still comes from fossil fuels like methane gas.In 2022 Toyota contributed to 1.5% of the world’s total carbon emissions with the cars they sold. With millions of people threatened by scorching temperatures wildfires and record-setting storms Toyota must reverse its course on climate.Ask #Toyota to end fossil fuel cars. Indigenous activists from the Awyu and Moi Peoples of Tanah Papua employed traditional ceremonies to call on Indonesia’s Supreme Court this week to protect their traditional land and forests from destruction for palm oil plantations. They held prayers rituals and performed dances in front of the Supreme Court building in Jakarta and also brought a piece of their homeland as a symbol to hand over to the court.“The legal struggle of the Awyu and Moi Peoples is an honourable effort for the sake of their customary forests for the lives of their children and grandchildren and indirectly for the sake of all of us. We invite the public to support the struggle of the Awyu and Moi and speak out about saving Papuas forests our stronghold in facing the climate crisis. - Sekar Banjaran Aji Greenpeace Indonesia forest campaigner#StandwithAwyu #SavePapuanForests #ClimateJustice #Indonesia

Some things should never change—especially the Amazon rainforest. Yet within our lifetime an area twice the size of mainland France has been lost.And no it’s not dwarves mining away in the forest. It’s illegal gold mining corporations and industrial agriculture burning and razing the land for quick profit.If we allow this to continue the world’s largest rainforest will reach a point of no return within the coming years.The survival of the Amazon depends on all of us—and we in turn depend on her to build a liveable future.🌿 Sign the petition now → Link in Bio#RespectTheAmazon #SnowWhite #Disney #SnowWhite2025

As 2024 was determined as the hottest year in recorded history devastating fires are raging right now in both Los Angeles county and Nahuel Huapi National Park in southern Argentina. The impact and images of the fires are heartbreaking.⁣.⁣The fires in Los Angeles county have already caused tens of thousands people to evacuate destroyed thousands of acres and displaced thousands of wildlife and pets. Communities in California are paying the ultimate price while corporations rake in record profits and pay nothing for the damage they cause.⁣.⁣In Argentina the loss of forests not only leaves a void in the landscape but intensifies droughts and floods threatens the survival of unique species and hits hard on local communities facing the saddest and most profound consequences of this destruction.⁣.⁣These images are reminders of our collective suffering across national borders.⁣ Our hearts go out to those who are experiencing the unfolding tragedy in Southern California and Argentina. We must support each other. We must stand beside our family friends neighbors and strangers to ensure further safety and survival. We must demand fossil fuel corporations stop fueling the climate crisis and start paying for the damage they are causing to life on our planet.⁣⁣California credit: © David McNew / Greenpeace⁣Argentina credit: Administración de Parques Nacionales - Argentina

Fossil gas isn’t clean energy—no matter how much oil and gas companies try to greenwash it! ⁣⁣Wind and solar are. ⁣⁣To keep global heating below 1.5°C we must invest in renewables now and urgently phase out fossil gas coal and oil.⁣⁣Join our call to #StopFossilGas⁣ ➡️ act.gp/stopfossilfuels (link in bio) ⁣⁣#WorldCleanEnergyDay

Big oil has known about the harmful effects of fossil fuels on climate change since at least the 1970s but chose to spend billions of US dollars spreading misinformation. This strategy including funding think tanks to cast doubt on climate science has delayed global efforts to combat global warming.Equinor was reportedly fined NOK 50 million in 2005 for price manipulation in Sweden. Total was fined EUR 500000 in France in 2018 for paying bribes to secure a major gas contract in Iran in 1997.BP’s Deepwater Horizon oil spill in 2010 spilled millions of barrels of oil into the Gulf of Mexico causing extensive damage to livelihoods marine life and habitats. In 2004 BP promoted the term ‘carbon footprint’ to shift blame for global heating onto individuals deflecting attention from big oil corporations.In the 1960s Texaco (now Chevron) dumped billions of gallons of toxic wastewater into rivers polluting groundwater and farmland. According to Amazonwatch Chevron disregarded environmental regulations earning an extra US$5 billion over 20 years. In 2016 Indigenous communities and farmers won a court judgement against Chevron but the company refused to pay.Since Shell arrived in 1958 Nigeria’s Ogoniland once fertile suffered from toxic spills. Ken Saro-Wiwa led peaceful resistance against Shell protesting its exploitation of Ogoniland. Under Saro-Wiwa’s leadership locals challenged Shell and Nigeria’s military regime leading to violent crackdowns. Ken Saro-Wiwa and 8 colleagues were wrongfully convicted and executed by the Nigerian government on November 10 1995.Big oil’s contribution to climate change has worsened extreme weather disasters causing significant financial and social costs for affected communities. The recovery burden falls on those least able to handle such crises. It’s time we ask: Who pays?How would you rate the legacy of big oil corporations? Tell us in the comments 👀✊...#stopdrilingstartpaying
A not so gentle reminder..#StopDrillingStartPaying #EndFossilFuels #MakePollutersPay

Here are some facts about the Climate Justice Delivery Service:⁣⁣🌪️ The service was established in 2024 to deliver debris from extreme weather events to the doorsteps of oil corporations. ⁣⁣🏚️ Destroyed items donated by survivors of extreme weather events such as floods wildfires and storms are collected and sent to big oil and gas corporations to highlight how their operations are destroying lives and communities.⁣⁣Extreme weather events including typhoons and floods are becoming more frequent and more severe  due to climate change caused by the burning of oil and gas. Homes are destroyed lives are claimed and people are forced to move.⁣⁣🧸 Debris including items like damaged children’s toys and furniture have been gathered with extreme weather survivors in countries like Brazil the Philippines and South Africa. The collected debris presents the damage caused by global warming.⁣⁣💀 Fossil fuels drilled by major oil companies such as Shell BP and Exxon are releasing greenhouse gases that heat the planet. To keep global warming below 1.5°C the use of oil and gas must be stopped. This includes halting all new fossil fuel projects and transitioning to renewable energy like wind and solar.⁣⁣A demand is being made by Greenpeace for oil and gas companies to stop drilling switch to clean energy and take responsibility by paying for the damage caused by global warming. The goal is to protect the planet for future generations.⁣⁣As more and more people are standing against Big Oil the industry gets desperate. It is now trying to use lawsuits to continue with its toxic business as usual. Corporations like Shell ENI TotalEnergies and energytransferlp have taken Greenpeace organisations to court. Using lawsuits against activists organisations and indigenous leaders Big Oil is trying to silence those standing to protect the earth. ⁣⁣Big Oils desperation shows we’re making an impact. Share to demand that Big Oil takes responsibility. Sign the #StopDrillingStartPaying -petition: link in bio greenpeace ✊⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#ClimateJustice #ClimateJusticeDelivery⁣

It’s time to resist.⁣⁣Days before Canadians head to vote Greenpeace Canada illuminated Niagara Falls to call out the billionaires oligarchs and corporate bullies are attacking our rights and freedoms and will stop at nothing – even weaponizing the legal system to crush dissent and silence environmental activism.⁣⁣This a call to fight for a world where collective solidarity replaces individualism and corporate greed.⁣⁣A call to resist together.

You can’t sue a rainbow 🌈 ⁣⁣No matter what happens in any courtroom – our global intersectional climate movement will  only keep growing stronger and louder 💚🌎⁣⁣#WeWillNotBeSilenced ⁣⁣The fossil fuel industry is desperate to silence and divide us — but we will always defend the right to peaceful protest. And we will continue to do what we have always done: advocate for the planet for justice and for future generations.⁣

Just within these past couple of weeks many parts of Asia faced or are facing devastating floods which have impacted the lives of hundreds and thousands. ⁣⁣These images are reminders of our collective suffering across national borders.⁣⁣We stand in solidarity with those impacted by this disaster and hope that rescue and relief operations reach them soon.⁣⁣Image one: An man is carrying a television set in the flood-affected Jakhalabandha in Nagaon District of Assam India on July 13 2024. 📷: Anuwar Hazarika/NurPhoto via Getty Images. ⁣⁣Image two: A man wades through a flooded street during heavy rainfall in Lahore on August 1 2024. 📷: SYED MURTAZA/AFP/Getty Images.⁣⁣Image three: People are wading through the flood in Kathmandu Nepal on July 31 2024. 📷: Subaas Shrestha/NurPhoto via Getty Images.⁣⁣Image four: Aerial view of water gushing out from sluiceways of the Xiaolangdi Reservoir on the Yellow River on July 24 2024 in Jiyuan Henan Province of China. The Xiaolangdi Reservoir has continued to release floodwater since July 18. 📷: VCG/VCG via Getty Images.⁣⁣Image five: Residents struggle to wade through almost neck-deep floods and evacuate to safety in San Mateo Rizal typhoon Gaami and monsoon repercussions in the 🇵🇭Philippines. 📷: Noel Celis / Greenpeace⁣⁣⁣#ClimateCrisis #ClimateChange #EndFossilFuels #StopDrillingStartPaying #SaveThePlanet #Greenpeace greenpeaceindia greenpeace.southasia greenpeaceph #pakistan #nepal #philippines #india

This is what deforestation looks like in Argentina. Clearing and deforestation are aggressively advancing on the native forests of northern Argentina according to a recent report from greenpeacearg based on satellite monitoring imagery.To understand the magnitude of the damage caused these images show some of the highlights from this new investigation along with part of the photographic survey of cleared areas. Commemorating the 79th anniversary of Indonesias independence on 17 August 2024 GreenpeaceID activists unfurled a giant red banner Indonesia is not for sale Merdeka! (Freedom) close to Indonesias new capital city Nusantara (IKN) in East Kalimantan.This action was a part of activities held together with numerous civil society organisations and local residents who are voicing various concerns about environmental damage caused by the IKN development also about the weakening of democracy in the country.IKN is a microcosm of what’s impacted the island of Kalimantan (Borneo) over past decades. Indonesian government collusion with pulpwood and palm oil oligarchs has been the main driver for the loss of 15 million hectares of forest. At least 150000 orangutans have been lost.The IKN that he (Indonesian president Joko Widodo) is proud of is in fact a haphazard and reckless project that takes away the rights of indigenous and local communities. It only provides the red carpet for oligarchs. - Arie Rompas Greenpeace Indonesia Campaign Leader#PeopleOverProfit #ClimateCrisis #Indonesia

“Nothing is as powerful as an idea whose time has come.”The great State of New York has passed a groundbreaking Make Polluters Pay law!💰 This important new law will make fossil fuel companies and other major polluters pay US$3 billion every year (a total of US$75 billion over 25 years) to support projects that help communities adapt to global warming.Also because the law uses the companies past emissions oil corporations can’t make regular people pay for these costs.What city/region/country should make polluters pay next?📣 Tag your state or national political leader in the comments and tell them to follow suit!#stopdrillingstartpaying #makepolluterspay

Fossil fuel companies knew decades ago that their products would cause devastating climate change. Drilling and burning these fuels heats our planet and supercharges extreme weather events like deadly heat waves floods fires and hurricanes.It’s about time world leaders held Big Oil companies to account and made them stop drilling and start paying for their climate damage.Link in our bio.📹​ © Bárbara Umbra / Tuane Fernandes / Christian Braga / Byron Ross / Valentina Ricardo / Greenpeace#climatecrisis #climatechange #extremeweather #floods #droughts #fires #bigoilknew #stopdrillingstartpaying #taxoilprofits #livesbeforeprofits

Malawis Tropical Cyclone Freddy affected over 2.2 million people forcing 650000+ to relocate and causing US$506.7 million in losses and damages. 🇲🇼⁣⁣Pakistans catastrophic floods in 2022 caused over US$14.9 billion in damages affecting 33 million people and causing 1700+ deaths. 🇵🇰⁣⁣Over 30 million people were forced to leave their homes due to weather-related events. In 2020 alone 🏚️ ⁣⁣Currently big oil pays NOTHING towards the costs of increasingly severe extreme weather events despite the fact that they have known for decades that theyre fueling them. The price is left with you and me and especially those hit the hardest. ⁣⁣Who pays? People or polluters?⁣⁣We say it is time to make polluters pay for their damages. You can too #linkinbio 👆⁣⁣#stopdrillingstartpaying⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣Sources: ⁣For Pakistan: (World Bank 2022)⁣For Malawi: (Government of Malawi)⁣Stamp Out Poverty 2024⁣UN 2023 ⁣

Greenpeace Sweden has hidden three valuable artworks by the artist and activist Britta Marakatt-Labba among the trees in the forests of Ohredahke Sámi community – a creative and powerful protest against SCAs extensive logging. The artworks including the original design for the Göteborg Film Festivals official poster risk being destroyed if SCA continues its clear-cutting.⁣⁣Ohredahke Sámi community has long fought against the companys reckless logging practices that threaten both the forest and reindeer herding. Now the community has withdrawn its consent for logging notifications on its central grazing lands – areas crucial for reindeer herding.⁣⁣This protest is highlighted at the Göteborg Film Festival where a film about the action was shown during the opening. In line with the festival theme “Focus Disobedience we raise the question”. ⁣⁣Greenpeace has also set up cameras in the forests live-streaming to a cinema at the festival and online – so if SCA starts logging they’ll be doing it right in front of an audience.⁣⁣If SCA dares to log here they wont just destroy the valuable forest of Ohredahke but these precious works of art – while you watch.⁣⁣Click the link in bio to watch the livestream. ⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣⁣#StandWithSápmi #ProtectTheForest #Artivism⁣
The more we appreciate the nature the more we understand how vital it is to protect the precious planet we call Earth and home. #EarthDay 💚 🌏

JUST IN: The Hague has ruled that Shell can continue polluting! ⁣⁣Shell has a responsibility for reducing its CO2-emission according to the court. The judges also state that Shell’s investments in new oil and gas fields may be at odds with the Paris agreement. Yet it did not uphold the ruling of 2021 that Shell must reduce 45% CO2 by 2030. ⁣⁣The need to #stopdrillingstartpaying couldnt be more urgent. We must hold Big Polluters to account!⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#climatechange #Shell

Greenpeace condemns the expansion of violence in the Middle East. ⁣⁣The ongoing bombing of Lebanon by Israel and its continued destruction and killing in Gaza and the West Bank must end.⁣⁣With tens of thousands killed and millions of people displaced in the region in the past year alone this horror must stop. ⁣⁣World powers must go beyond words to prevent further bloodshed.⁣⁣We continue to add our voice calling for an immediate comprehensive and permanent ceasefire throughout the Middle East!⁣⁣We call upon the Israeli government not to repeat its actions in Gaza in Lebanon. ⁣⁣Greenpeace MENA staff based in Beirut bear witness to the devastation and indiscriminate nature of the bombings that have taken over 2000 lives. They are among the 1.2 million displaced Lebanese people.⁣⁣We repeat our call for a global embargo on all arms sales and transfers that could be used to further increase the toll of war crimes to be answered once the violence subsides.⁣⁣Violence is not the answer it only brings more violence.⁣⁣We further call for the immediate release of all remaining hostages over 100 and all illegally detained civilians.⁣⁣Greenpeace calls for an end to the illegal occupation of Palestine. Greenpeace supports the UNSC Resolution ambition that “Israel and Palestine live side by side in peace within secure and recognised borders consistent with international law and relevant UN resolutions.⁣⁣Beyond the urgent need to end the civilian suffering and ecological devastation all parties must resume peaceful negotiations towards a lasting peace built on safety justice and equal rights for all. ⁣⁣#CeasefireNow #MiddleEast #Lebanon #Palestine #Gaza #Israel⁣
As fossil fuel companies post obscene profits the damage their products create continue to wreak havoc around the world. Enough is enough. Its time to #makepolluterspay

💥💥NEWS WORTH CELEBRATING!!!⁣⁣Monaco has become the first European country to ratify the Global Ocean Treaty💪💪. This brings the total number of ratifications to 5 🐋🐋. The Treaty can only create global ocean sanctuaries once 60 governments have signed it into their national laws. We urge all government to ratify the Treaty to ensure we can protect at least 30% of the oceans by 2030!⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#ProtectTheOceans #GlobalOceanTreaty #OceanJustice #oceans ⁣

The ongoing battle against Big Oil bully Energy Transfer’s meritless SLAPP lawsuit is a fight for freedom of speech and the right to peaceful protest. And it is far from over.⁣⁣Being SLAPPed with a liability of more than US$660 million for something we so clearly did not do is not for the faint of heart. But we are not faint of heart. Greenpeace has never been a movement that shies away from big fights.⁣⁣They thought they could break us. They thought they could intimidate us into silence. They were wrong. They blew wind into our sails and we grew bigger and stronger than ever before.⁣⁣We will not back down. ⁣We will not be silenced.⁣⁣Check the link in our bio for the full message from Greenpeace International Executive Director Mads Christensen 💚🌎

Drill baby drill.Trump’s decision defies both science and diplomacy. A week ago Tropical Storm Kristine (Trami) dumped two months worth of rain in the Philippines flooding multiple provinces and killing hundreds. This is not the first time that an extreme weather event laid waste in the country and it will definitely not be the last. So as climate change worsens and climate action remains scant we ask: How many more typhoons do we have to endure? How many floods? How many deaths?⁣⁣Read the full blog in the link in our bio.

Greenpeace needs your support against Big Oil company Energy Transfer’s attempt to silence us.⁣⁣A meritless lawsuit filed by energytransferlp against Greenpeace threatens our continued existence as well as the future of peaceful protest and activism around the world. ⁣⁣Check the link in our bio to sign a petition that tells Energy Transfer and all corporate bullies: I am with Greenpeace!⁣⁣For more than 50 years Greenpeace has taken action in defense of people and the planet. To ensure we can continue this work we need your support. The lawsuit against Greenpeace USA and Greenpeace International filed by Energy Transfer — a US-based fossil fuel company who is responsible for the Dakota Access Pipeline that sparked a Indigenous-led protest movement in 2016 — makes allegations that affect people far beyond Greenpeace: Not only an attempt to undermine the Indigenous leadership of the Standing Rock movement this lawsuit aims to silence anyone with the courage to stand up to polluters in their own backyard. ⁣⁣Show your community that you support Greenpeace by sharing this post 💚⁣⁣Tell energytransferlp they cannot silence the call for a green and peaceful future by signing the petition linked in our bio ✍️⁣

They can afford it! The oil and gas industry is making huge profits from people’s suffering—reportedly over US$2.8 billion EVERY DAY for the past 50 years.⁣⁣Currently big oil pays NOTHING towards the costs of increasingly severe extreme weather events despite the fact that they have known for decades that theyre fueling extreme weather but invested billions to hinder climate action.‌⁣⁣The price is left with all of us especially those hit the hardest.⁣⁣The question is: who pays? People or polluters?⁣⁣#StopDrillingStartPaying (See link in bio)⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣Image copyright: Netflix

I’m in your food and inside your body. I’m in the ocean inside fish and in the air you breathe. What am I? That’s right — plastic.Plastic pollution is everywhere damaging the health of humans animals and the natural world. It pollutes the air and fuels the climate crisis. Globally only 9% of plastic gets recycled and if nothing is done plastic production is projected to triple by the year 2050! But right now we have a once-in-a-generation opportunity to tackle the crisis on a global scale — a Global Plastics Treaty that drastically cuts plastic production!Throughout July waterbearnetwork is backing Greenpeace to call for a strong and ambitious #PlasticsTreaty before the critical fifth and last round of UN talks pick back up in Busan Korea!Tap the link in our Instagram bio (Greenpeace) to join us in demanding world leaders deliver a strong Global Plastics Treaty that will cut plastic production! Keep following Waterbear in July to learn more about the plastic problem.#PlasticsTreaty #plastics #singleuseplastics #plasticfree #plasticpollution #greenpeace #waterbear

🛍️​💳​ Online shopping is booming… But it comes at a price: the e-commerce sector is a major user of cardboard to package and ship their products. This is becoming a big threat to critical ecosystems 🌳​🪚​📦​Through field investigations and the use of wood trackers by greenpeacesverige big players like Amazon Zalando and HelloFresh together with about a hundred other companies have been connected to suppliers linked to the destruction of valuable Swedish forests.Were talking about some of Europe’s LAST remaining precious ancient forests. It is URGENT that corporations especially those tied to the e-commerce sector clean up their supply chains.Go to greenpeace.org/international or tap the link in our Instagram bio to read more.#report #investigation #deforestation #clearcutting #forest #forestprotection #sweden #sverige #greenpeace #greenpeacesverige #Sámi #IndigenousPeoples #IndigenousRights #onlineshopping #ecommerce #Amazon #HelloFresh #Zalando #packaging #cardboard #unboxing

Massive floods caused by Tropical Storm #Kristine (Trami) ravaged the #Philippines over the past few days forcing over 30000 people to flee their homes. A whole months worth of rain was dumped during a 24-hour window resulting to major damages in bridges roads and farmlands. ⁣⁣The Philippines is one of the most vulnerable countries to #ClimateChange and typhoons have gotten more intense in recent years. Extreme weather events like these are a glaring reminder of the lack of urgent climate action from world leaders and how peoples lives are still being neglected for the sake of profit.⁣⁣Photos by Noel Celis / Greenpeace ⁣⁣#ClimateAction #MakePollutersPay #flood #disaster #bicol ⁣⁣

BREAKING 🚨 Total made USD 18.3BILLION in profit last year! ⁣⁣It was also the hottest year on record for the planet.⁣⁣Fossil fuels are the biggest contributor to the climate crisis that causes communities to push through devastating extreme weather everywhere. ⁣⁣The fossil fuel industry has been aware of the crisis they cause for decades but have hidden the truth and discredited the scientific evidence. ⁣⁣The economic cost solely from weather and climate events in 2023 was an estimated USD 301 billion (according to insurers Gallagher Re). Now Fossil fuel companies need to pay the price for the damages they’ve consciously caused. ⁣⁣People families and communities are paying the price while fossil fuel companies are making record profits out of their suffering.⁣⁣Their profit is our loss.⁣⁣Our governments must protect our families and communities and make oil companies stop drilling and start paying for the damage they’ve caused and the just and fair transition we need.⁣⁣‼️ Tag your decision-makers in the comments below with a message to phase out fossil fuels to make way for a green safe and more just society. ⁣⁣#StopDrillingStartPaying #TheirProfitOurLoss⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣📷 Patrick Pouyanné Total in a retouched image (Top). 🚨 Dramatic increases to deforestation and fire hotspots in the Brazilian Amazon rainforest were measured in July. In July 2024 666 km² of deforestation was recorded a 33.2% increase from deforestation measured in July 2023. Also in July 2024 the largest number of fire hotspots for the month was recorded since 2005 the year in which the biome suffered historic fires. Compared to July 2023 the increase in fire hotspots in July 2024 was 98%. Between 29 July and 2 August greenpeacebrasil monitoring flights recorded fires in the Brazilian states of Amazonas and Rondônia.Brazil’s government must step up actions to prevent fires to reduce deforestation and crack down on environmental criminals. All around the world we must remember that those who finance forest destroyers are also part of the problem! .📸: © Marizilda Cruppe...#deforestation #amazon #greenpeace

Trillions in profit trillions in damage. ⁣⁣Right now governments are considering whether to tax oil and gas corporations for the damages they have caused.⁣⁣World leaders could force Big Oil to pay to help communities around the world recover and rebuild from climate impacts and invest in climate solutions. But only if we raise the pressure.⁣ ⁣France’s emmanuelmacron and Kenya’s williamsamoeiruto are two key leaders of the coalition of countries considering this proposal.⁣⁣On Friday we delivered our petition to the coalition - with over HALF A MILLION of your signatures - demanding they take action. ⁣⁣Will they act or back down?⁣⁣Tag them in the comments and tell them its time to make polluters pay.⁣⁣#stopdrillingstartpaying⁣

laurabaldwin80 was angry when she learned that the Olympic Committee had chosen one of the top carbon emitters in the world to sponsor the Games. ⁣⁣Toyota the world’s largest producer of fossil fuel vehicles has received the gold medal for carbon emissions among all Olympics sponsors according to the latest Polluters on the Podium report by the New Weather Institute.⁣⁣#Toyota sits at the top with CO2 emissions surpassing those of the Olympic host nation France and exceeding those of all but 11 participating countries. This contrasts sharply with the #ParisOlympics aim to be the most sustainable Olympics.⁣⁣“I’m aware that unless humanity makes a dramatic U-turn the competition most of the world’s youth will likely face in coming years will be for food and fresh water. The fact that companies like Toyota are delaying the necessary transition pains me deeply.”⁣⁣Together with 13 other Olympians British Olympic Sailor and two-time Olympic Sailing Coach laurabaldwin80 has raised concerns about Toyota as a key sponsor of the Olympics.⁣⁣Demand Toyota to end fossil fuel cars send an open letter now - link in bio.⁣⁣#DriveChange #ZeroEmission #ActOnClimate #Toyota #Paris2024 #Olympics #ParisOlympics #Greenpeace
Nature connects us all. We must ensure a sustainable and just future for people and the planet 💚⁣

These barrage of storm after storm after storm hitting the Philippines isn’t normal anymore. The storms the Filipinos have to contend with are becoming more frequent and much stronger because of the continued heating of the oceans caused by climate change.And the really bad news? This current storm is not the last storm of the year.To bring justice we have to make oil and gas companies responsible which are making the climate crisis worse due to the continued expansion of their businesses. They continue to get richer while we will continue to suffer under the severe effects of climate change. This cannot go on.#ClimateJusticeNow! #philippines #climatechange #typhoon #climateemergency

You might be flabbergasted but you need to watch John Oliver lastweektonight talking about Michael Lodge the current Secretary General at the International Seabed Authority (ISA).The ISA is the UN-affiliated body in charge of the regulation of the deep sea. Governments are negotiating on deep sea mining to decide if this destructive industry should be allowed. The role of the Secretary General is key. With the election for a Secretary General for the next 4 years coming it might be time for change. Watch and share!#StopDeepSeaMining #ISBA29 #ProtectTheOceans

We cant agree more! ⁣⁣In a powerful interview with the nytimes Irish author Sally Rooney took the opportunity to talk beyond the plot and share her views on our broken economic system. In the interviews podcast version she also highlighted: I dont feel myself thinking about my growth as an artist if you will (...) I think that there is a huge cultural fixation with novelty and growth. Our whole economic system is built on constant permanent ceaseless growth. We all have to grow everything has to grow all the time. Get bigger sell more be different. Novelty reinvention. Those are the principles of our present culture.⁣⁣The true value of people and the planet is also hidden behind this obsession with growth. GDP and the obsession with growth has long been the standard for economic success but it is not made for people to live their best lives.⁣⁣⁣Join and sign our #WellbeingForAll petition via link in our bio 👆⁣⁣And...before devouring Sally Rooneys new book let us know how you imagine a thriving planet without a suffocating economic system. ✊ 💚

GUESS WHO doesnt care about GDP or share prices and would like governments and corporations to put #PeopleBeforeProfits?⁣⁣Thats right most people as shown by a new survey from @‌_earth4all and Global Commons Alliance.⁣⁣It is clear that the economy as we know it is no longer serving us. Follow us as we take you through the #UNTaxConvention which starts at the end of July. This is a historic opportunity to prioritise health and wellbeing by changing how global taxes work.⁣⁣Sign our petition to demand #WellbeingForAll. Link in bio 👆

We’re LOVIN’ IT! 🌳 🌳🌳⁣⁣After thousands of Australians called out mcdonaldsau has committed to going deforestation-free 🎉⁣⁣HOWEVER they have committed to doing this by the end of 2030… which is 5 years later than what is desperately needed for our forests and wildlife.⁣⁣Every day between now and 2030 means more forests lost wildlife displaced and damage to our planet. The fight for climate justice is gaining ground – and more and more often people and communities are challenging Big Oil and Gas companies in court. ⁣⁣A new report – titled Big Oil in Court – The latest trends in climate litigation against fossil fuel companies – reveals at least 86 climate lawsuits have been filed against the world’s largest oil gas and coal producing corporations – including BP Chevron Eni ExxonMobil Shell and TotalEnergies. These lawsuits seek compensation for climate damages challenge false advertising and demand emissions reductions. The number of these cases filed each year has nearly tripled since the Paris Agreement to limit global temperature rise was reached in 2015. ⁣⁣Report by: priceofoil and Zero Carbon Analytics⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#ClimateJustice #ClimateAction #EndFossilFuels

Greenpeace Norway activists delivered debris from recent floods in Brazil to Equinor CEO’s house. Fossil fuel executives make decisions every day that lead to more extreme weather and more people losing their homes and livelihoods. ⁣⁣💀 According to Greenpeace Netherlands Equinor’s 2022 emissions alone could cause 34000 premature temperature-related deaths by 2100. ⁣⁣💀 Less than 1% of Equinor’s energy production was renewable in 2023. ⁣⁣💀 80% of their investments went to climate-wrecking oil and gas. ⁣⁣💀 Equinor is aggressively pursuing new oil and gas projects in the UK Argentina Canada Tanzania and Brazil.⁣⁣As the CEO of one of the world’s largest oil companies Anders Opedal is personally responsible for the impact Equinor’s oil and gas is having. ⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#stopdrillingstartpaying⁣*Image of the CEO in this post is staged and doctored for illustrative purposes.⁣

Its the first heatwave this early in June in 50 years with temperatures exceeding 40 degrees in several areas. 🌡️⁣⁣⚠️ The oil and gas industry pollutes our atmosphere fuelling extreme weather everywhere and they have known for decades that their production is causing the climate crisis. Instead of addressing the threat they covered it up.⁣⁣While people around the world are looking for relief from the searing heat and to rebuild and recover from climate chaos governments protect the big oil corporations who enjoy huge profits from people’s suffering.⁣⁣Currently Big Oil pays NOTHING towards the costs of increasingly severe extreme weather events. They pass on the human and financial cost to all of us. ⁣⁣Who do you think should pay? ⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#MakePollutersPay #StopDrillingStartPaying⁣

EVERY SINGLE annual shareholder meeting of Europe’s major fossil fuel companies has been DISRUPTED.⁣⁣Because new oil and gas WILL increase your bills escalate climate chaos destroy biodiversity and put humanity at risk.⁣⁣Here’s what happened👇⁣⁣📌TotalEnergies France: Activists unfolded a 100m² WANTED banner for Patrick Pouyanné TotalEnergies CEO who is fuelling the climate crisis. In 2023 they pocketed almost €20 BILLION 💶 in profits. Meanwhile in France 12 MILLION people struggle to pay their energy bills. ⁣⁣📌Equinor Norway: Campaigners from around the world demanded that the Norwegian government and Equinors shareholders STOP Equinors foreign projects and all new oil and gas exploration. New oil and gas projects ARE NOT compatible with the 1.5°C limit.⁣⁣📌Repsol Spain: Activists denounced Repsols plan to distribute more than €2460 MILLION among its shareholders from a dirty business that causes death and destruction. They swim in money while the world falls apart.⁣⁣📌Shell the UK: ‘SHELL KILLS’ sang activists with fossilfreelondon to protest the devastation at their hands. The Niger Delta is among the most polluted places because of Shell. Life expectancy is JUST 41. Yet Shell CONTINUES to build NEW fossil fuel extraction sites.⁣⁣📌omv Austria: Activists set up a huge drilling rig warning: If there was gas here OMV would drill. OMV plans the EUs LARGEST new gas project Neptun Deep putting at risk our climate and a unique ecosystem all for profit 💶. Governments must BAN new gas projects. Our lives are at stake.⁣⁣#StopFossilGas #StopDrillingStartPaying #EquinorOut #StopRosebank #ShellKills⁣

Two years ago world leaders made history by agreeing on the Global Ocean Treaty. Through this game-changing tool governments can create ocean sanctuaries off-limits to destructive industries plundering the ocean for profit. But a treaty on paper means nothing without real action.The UN Ocean Conference is only 100 days away and to make the Treaty work at sea 60 governments must turn it into national law. Right now only 18 have stepped up. Scientists warn that we must protect 30% of the ocean by 2030 for marine life to recover. The clock is ticking. Governments CAN still meet this goal but only if they act now.📢 Add your voice! Sign the petition and demand urgent action.#ProtectTheOceans

We welcome todays ceasefire agreement between Hamas and Israel.⁣⁣Greenpeace calls upon the international community to do everything it can to support the innocent victims of the conflict - the majority of whom are women and children -  and to ensure a lasting peace in which Israelis and Palestinians can live side by side.⁣⁣Even as the immediate conflict stops lives will continue to be lost in the days weeks months and years to come as a consequence of the brutal and indiscriminate violence.⁣⁣Today must be the first day on the long road to healing in which the deafening noise of bullets and bombs gives way to negotiations towards a lasting peace built on safety justice and equal rights for all. In the wake of the humanitarian and ecological carnage International law must be upheld.⁣⁣Greenpeace recognises the deep historic roots that need to be discussed and negotiated if a permanent peace is to be established. Greenpeace calls for an end to the illegal occupation of Palestine. Greenpeace supports the UNSC Resolution ambition that “Israel and Palestine live side by side in peace within secure and recognised borders consistent with international law and relevant UN resolutions.⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#CeasefireNow

For the 3rd year greenpeaceph joined this year’s #PrideMarch with the call “Earth For All” at the Quezon Memorial Circle in Quezon City. 🏳️‍🌈🏳️‍🌈⁣⁣The climate crisis magnifies existing inequities exposing #LGBTQIA2S+ individuals to increased vulnerability and discrimination during climate-induced disasters. ⁣⁣Queer individuals often face discrimination in accessing transitional housing and essential services and encounter disrespect due to prejudice and bigotry. Relief and recovery efforts typically conducted through a binary cisgender lens often neglect queer individuals highlighting the need for inclusive policies that protect everyone.⁣⁣Greenpeace has long championed climate justice which demands fairness and equity among the most vulnerable sectors. It is imperative that our institutions prioritize the needs of marginalized communities. ⁣⁣To learn more check our link in bio ⬆️⬆️

This week the path to a brighter future got a bit dimmer.⁣⁣But that does not mean we cannot see it anymore.⁣⁣Well never stop fighting for what we believe in.⁣⁣⁣⁣PEACE not war.⁣⁣CREATIVITY not destruction.⁣⁣EMPATHY not hate.⁣⁣GENEROSITY not greed.⁣⁣EVERYBODY not just some.⁣⁣Tap the link in our Instagram bio to read the message sent to all Greenpeace staff around the world in response to Donald Trump being named president-elect of the United States. In this trying moment we also want to share it widely with allies and supporters because the road to a better future is one we travel together.⁣⁣via greenpeaceusa

From its incredible biodiversity to how it shapes the culture of millions of people on the planet the ocean shows its strength and resilience. But corporate greed is pushing our ocean to the limits and we have the chance to change this story.⁣⁣Starting on 21 October world leaders will gather for two weeks to discuss the future of nature. The UN Biodiversity COP16 will take place in Colombia and it is an important opportunity for the world to take meaningful action for preservation.⁣⁣Join us in demanding world leaders stay on the right side of history. Check our link in bio for more info.⁣⁣#GreenpeaceCOP16 #COP16Colombia #COP16⁣

Plastic pollution is not a waste management issue it is a production problem. Overproduction leads to waste management avenues being stretched.Single-use plastics significantly exacerbate the problems at dumpsites like Dandora in Nairobi as by their very nature are designed for immediate disposal. A legally binding plastic treaty will reign in this overproduction. Ask your government to support a strong plastic treaty! Sign the petition 👉  https://act.gp/419qeGi Linked on Greenpeace bio#GlobalPlasticTreaty #DandoraDumpsite

The fossil fuel industry is the world’s biggest contributor to climate change.⁣⁣Currently they pay NOTHING towards the costs of increasingly severe extreme weather events. ⁣⁣Currently the bill is being passed to ordinary people like YOU and those hit by extreme weather.⁣⁣Let’s change that.⁣⁣🏚️ Who should pay for the extreme weather damages? Tell us in the comments! 👇⁣⁣#StopDrillingStartPaying ⁣⁣* Source slide 6: Insurers Gallagher Re.⁣Image 5 copyright:  Warner Bros. Pictures

Construction for Europe’s largest new fossil gas drilling project is about to begin. ⁣⁣The drilling rig for this project has just left the port of Constanța Romania. But together we can stop it!⁣⁣We call on the Romanian authorities to immediately stop this project and prioritize projects that benefit people and nature instead of fossil gas companies. And we call on the EU to ban new fossil fuel projects once and for all and to phase-out fossil gas.⁣⁣🖌️ Sign the open letter now and help stop Neptun Deep and all new fossil fuel projects in Europe. Link in bio. ⁣⁣ ➡️ act.gp/stopfossilfuels ⁣⁣#StopFossilGas

Eni one of the world’s biggest polluters just announced €5.3BILLION in profits for 2024 — Earth’s hottest year on record.⁣⁣While Eni makes these obscene profits their business - the extraction and combustion of fossil fuels - is driving deadly extreme weather and damage to people’s homelands and livelihoods.⁣⁣⁣The hundreds of billions they rake in have been taken from the pockets of individuals and families pushing basic necessities out of reach for many - either directly through skyrocketing energy bills that have been exacerbating the cost of living or indirectly with industry tax breaks and subsidies.⁣⁣⁣Individuals families and small businesses should not have to bear rising energy costs or go without basic needs while oil and gas companies laugh all the way to the bank.⁣⁣⁣Their emissions poison our atmosphere while their waste contaminates the water we drink and the air we breathe. Treating our communities and planet as collateral damage these corporations ignore the consequences of extreme weather while homes are destroyed and livelihoods wiped out.⁣⁣⁣The fossil fuel industry has been aware of this crisis they caused for decades but have hidden the truth and discredited the scientific evidence. The economic cost solely from weather and climate events in 2023 was an estimated $ 301 billion USD* paid by the taxpayer.⁣⁣It’s time for justice: governments must make these companies stop drilling for polluting fuels and start paying for the damage they’ve caused and the just and fair transition we need.⁣⁣Tag @‌eni in the comments and demand they stop drilling and start paying!⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣📸 Claudio Descalzi CEO of Eni in a retouched image (top).⁣⁣Woman near her house after floods in Migori and Homa Bay Counties in Kenya in 2020 (below).⁣⁣*According to insurers Gallagher Re⁣⁣Images of CEOs used in this campaign are staged and doctored for illustrative purposes. Illustrations are created without the use of generative AI.⁣⁣⁣#stopdrillingstartpaying #climatecrisis

Its SO frustrating to watch the world being torn apart and geopolitical tensions dominating the news while climate chaos accelerates and millions of lives are shattered by climate disasters every month.All the images and videos in this post date from the last few days or weeks.Literally no problem at all can be solved if we don’t stop climate breakdown.Every fraction of degree of warming matters and every bit of climate resilience we build together makes a difference.Lets start by putting an end to the impunity of the companies that have spent decades denying deceiving and delaying climate action: the fossil fuel giants.Let’s keep fighting to #MakePollutersPay.Tap the link in our bio#StopDrillingStartPaying #LivesBeforeProfits #ExtremeWeather #ClimateCrisis #floods #heat #fires

We’re celebrating World Oceans Day with actress model and TV presenter amandadupont who recently met coastal communities in Senegal to support them in their fight for survival. Deeply touched by the encounter Amanda said: “These communities have a special relationship with the ocean because fishing has been in their families for centuries the ocean is in their blood. However the industrial fishing industry is robbing them of their livelihoods and destroying their way of life and they’ve had enough! From Thailand to Senegal they’re taking a stand against corporations plundering the oceans for profit stealing food from their tables and leaving their families to go hungry. I’m standing with them will you? Sign the petition at the link in our bio!#WorldOceansDay

Started by a small group of passionate Pasifika students the #ClimateICJAO campaign has grown into the biggest climate case in history demanding accountability for a liveable planet. 🌏⚖️⁣⁣International Court of Justice Advisory Opinion (ICJAO) is an initiative by the world championed by the youth of the Pacific taking the worlds biggest problem of climate change to the worlds highest court - the International Court of Justice (ICJ). ⁣⁣Now the issue is in court and during the public hearings starting December 2 we will hear states present so that the ICJ can consider all evidence and real impact stories. The court will also hand out an advisory opinion on what states responsibilities are when it comes to addressing climate change in ensuring the protection of the human rights of current and future generations.⁣⁣These voices can’t wait. And as their islands sink lands flood and livelihoods continue to be uprooted the #WitnessStand brings their raw stories to light. 💙🙏⁣⁣🎥 The “Witness Stand” is a collection of videos created by our friends at pisfcc co-created with the interactivemediafoundation’s not.just.celsius and in partnership with wy4cj.⁣⁣#ClimateJusticeAtTheICJ #ClimateJustice ⁣

Greenpeace activists in more than 15 cities around the world are expressing solidarity against the abusive legal tactics of US-based fossil fuel company EnergyTransferLP (ET) during two sustained global weeks of action. Greenpeace International (GPI) and the Greenpeace entities in the US are currently defending against a meritless US$ 300 million lawsuit from ET related to the Indigenous-led protests against the Dakota Access Pipeline in 2016. ⁣⁣From Sydney to Dallas this global week of action sends a clear message: “We will not be silenced!”⁣⁣Globally more and more corporations are using dirty legal tricks like SLAPP suits to intimidate and silence their critics. Hundreds of SLAPPs spanning every continent are currently in progress. This case brought by Energy Transfer is one of the most egregious and if it goes unanswered it will embolden other companies to do the same. ⁣⁣Check the link in our bio to sign a petition that tells Energy Transfer and all corporate bullies: I am with Greenpeace!

Despite what you might see in movies this is what human trafficking usually looks like. No violent kidnapping no chains. But a person looking for work who ends up trapped in a cycle of exploitation.⁣⁣Follow migrant fisher Lukman* as he tries to claim what is rightfully his after toiling for months on end fishing for tuna on an industry vessel in international waters. ⁣⁣You can watch the hard hitting oceans documentary Before You Eat to learn more about the situation for so many migrant fishers in Southeast Asia. Register and watch for free via link in bio.⁣⁣*not his real name🎨: vireeys ⁣#ProtectOceansProtectWorkers#EndModernSlaveryatSEA⁣#StopIUUFishing

Greenpeace needs your support against Big Oil company Energy Transfer’s attempt to silence us⁣⁣A meritless lawsuit filed by energytransferlp against Greenpeace threatens our continued existence as well as the future of peaceful protest and activism around the world. ⁣⁣Check the link in our bio to sign a petition that tells Energy Transfer and all corporate bullies: I am with Greenpeace!⁣⁣For more than 50 years Greenpeace has taken action in defense of people and the planet. To ensure we can continue this work we need your support. The lawsuit against Greenpeace USA and Greenpeace International filed by Energy Transfer — a US-based fossil fuel company who is responsible for  the Dakota Access Pipeline that sparked a Indigenous-led protest movement in 2016 — makes allegations that affect people far beyond Greenpeace: Not only an attempt to undermine the Indigenous leadership of the Standing Rock movement this lawsuit aims to silence anyone with the courage to stand up to polluters in their own backyard. ⁣⁣Show your community that you support Greenpeace by sharing this post 💚⁣⁣Tell energytransferlp they cannot silence the call for a green and peaceful future by signing the petition linked in our bio ✍️

🚨 Greenpeace Nordic activists confront the deep sea mining industry!Named after the Norse god Loke known to be a deceitful trickster Loke Marine Minerals is one of the companies aiming to mine the seabed in the Arctic. We asked Yeb Saño climate activist & Executive Director of greenpeacesea what the relentless pursuit of growth takes away from the majority world. ⁣⁣“Time. Give us back our time the time stolen from all of us. Time with family and loved ones and time to be with our communities. Time to achieve our fullest potential. Time to enjoy our freedoms. Time. It sounds like this is a basic human right but I have to say it because we are a long way from achieving it. ⁣⁣In our campaign for a wellbeing economy we’re asking activists what their hidden gems are. Hidden gems are: ambitions dreams opportunities and too often the basic rights that GDP and a growth-obsessed economy keep out of reach for our generation.⁣⁣We’re calling for a future where people and the planet thrive together. ⁣🌱 Sign our petition today and let’s demand wellbeing for all!⁣⁣#WellbeingEconomy #Greenpeace ⁣

This morning greenpeaceth activists from Greenpeace flagship Rainbow Warrior conducted a peaceful protest against a proposed carbon capture and storage(CCS) site at the Arthit fossil gas field located in the Gulf of Thailand’s exclusive economic zone. The gas field is around 250KM from shore and takes over 20 hours to reach by boat⁣⁣The Arthit fossil gas field is operated by PTTEP It will be the site of Thailands first offshore carbon capture and storage project. It is expected to begin operations in 2027.⁣⁣Greenpeace Thailand calls on PTTEP to hold it accountable for its contribution to the climate crisis by stopping this carbon capture and storage plan immediately. ⁣⁣#ClimateCrisis #Thailand #Greenpeace

Will you say bana-NAH to deep sea mining? 🍌⁣⁣The Banana Hole is an area in the pristine Arctic that Norway wants to MINE in.⁣⁣Deep sea mining could have devastating irreversible impacts on wildlife like sperm whales and the countless other marine species that call these waters home 😨⁣⁣The good news is that deep sea mining hasnt started yet. 🚨 BREAKING: In 2024 Exxon Mobil made USD33.5billion in profit... it was also the hottest year on record for the planet!⁣⁣Fossil fuels are the biggest contributor to the climate crisis that causes communities to push through devastating extreme weather everywhere. ⁣⁣The fossil fuel industry has been aware of the crisis they cause for decades but have hidden the truth and discredited the scientific evidence. The economic cost solely from weather and climate events in 2023 was an estimated USD 301 billion (According to insurers Gallagher Re). Now Fossil fuel companies need to pay the price for the damages they’ve consciously caused. ⁣⁣People families and communities are paying the price while fossil fuel companies are making record profits out of their suffering.⁣Their profit is our loss.⁣⁣Goverments must protect our families and communities and make oil companies stop drilling and start paying for the damage they’ve caused and the just and fair transition we need.⁣⁣Tag your decision-makers in the comments below to phase out fossil fuels to make way for a green safe and more just society. #StopDrillingStartPaying (link in bio)⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣📷 Darren Woods Exxon Mobil in a retouched image (top). In a few weeks the EU Parliament will grill the candidates for jobs leading the EU Commissions policies on climate energy environment farming transport trade and more for the next 5 years.Europe must deliver on its commitment to the Global Biodiversity Framework: protect nature halt its destruction and invest in restoration. 📣 The destruction of nature threatens livelihoods in Europe and globally: join us and make YOUR voice heard. Send your message of #HopeForNature through the link in our bio!#DefundNatureDestruction #ProtectNature #LivesBeforeProfits #Greenpeace #Europe #EuropeanUnion

🇲🇭The flag of the Republic of the Marshall Islands flies at half-mast aboard the Rainbow Warrior in remembrance of the devastating Castle Bravo nuclear test. ⁣.⁣🌅71 years ago the U.S. detonated a nuclear bomb 1000x more powerful than Hiroshima. The explosion lit up the sky like a second sunrise—what Marshallese people call the Day of Two Suns. Radioactive fallout poisoned the communities all over the Marshall Islands forcing them to live in contamination for years leading to severe health issues environmental destruction and the displacement of entire populations. ⁣.⁣🌈Greenpeace and the Rainbow Warrior then and now has stood with the Marshall Islands. In 1985 Greenpeace helped the people of Rongelap evacuate after finding their land uninhabitable. Today while new threats like deep-sea mining and climate change emerge we return to stand with them once more in their ongoing fight for justice.⁣.⁣Check the link in bio to learn more about this history.⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#MarshallIslands #NuclearJustice  #History #JusticeforMarshallIslands #ClimateJustice #JimweImMaron

Richly forested Papua in Indonesia is on the frontline of both biodiversity and climate crises due to a relentless push by agribusiness companies backed by international finance that want to clear its forests to make way for palm oil paper pulp and other plantations. Since early 2000 when the Indonesian government started releasing permits for logging and palm oil companies Indigenous Peoples across the island have been engaged in a struggle with outsiders and the government who underestimate the strength of Indigenous connection to their land. For Biodiversity Day the Indigenous People of Knasaimos-Tehit in Papua showed and shared a little insight into what land and forest means for them. #NatureNow #DefundNatureDestruction #SavePapuanForests greenpeaceid
