🥳GREAT NEWS 🥳⁣⁣Thanks to you 💙 more than 1 MILLION people have signed our petition to protect the oceans 🙌 Without the oceans there would be no life on Earth. The oceans: ⁣🪸Regulate our climate ⁣🐠Provide food and jobs to billions of people⁣🐋 Are home to iconic creatures like whales and turtles ⁣⁣Scientists have said that we need to protect at least 30% of the oceans by 2030. If governments are serious about doing this they MUST back their words with actions and ratify the historic Global Ocean Treaty 🌊. ⁣⁣Governments can only use the Treaty to create global ocean sanctuaries once at least 60 countries have ratified it. Every moment they delay ratification the oceans suffer further destruction. ⁣⁣If you haven’t signed the petition yet check the link in our bio 👉 to urge your government to #ProtectTheOceans⁣

🚨URGENT UPDATE from Plastics Treaty talks in South Korea 🚨⁣⁣4 Greenpeace International activists were detained last night after peacefully protesting on a petrochemical vessel during final #PlasticsTreaty talks in South Korea. ⁣ ⁣These courageous activists endured freezing overnight temperatures for 12 hours to be the voice of millions of people around the world — calling on world leaders to cut plastic production. ⁣⁣These activists are sending a strong message to world leaders in the final hours of negotiations: if we can challenge the plastic industry so can world governments. ✊✊✊⁣ ⁣We urge world leaders to step up to deliver an ambitious treaty that cuts plastic production and call on the South Korean authorities to release our activists immediately!⁣ ⁣Sign and share today! Strong Plastics Treaty Now! ⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#Plastics #BreakFreeFromPlastic #ClimateCrisis #FossilFuels #EndOil #plasticpollution #realsolutions #plasticfree #zerowaste #Reuse #Refill #INC5 ⁣

🚨We need your help!Our activists - Al Ash Jens Sam and Rainbow Warrior Captain Hettie - are currently prohibited from leaving South Korea. They are under an ongoing investigation for the peaceful direct action that took place in Daesen city as a part of the ‘Zero Plastic Tour’ Rainbow Warrior ship tour in East Asia.ICYMI: On 30 November the 4 activists boarded a tanker that was about to load toxic plastic chemicals from South Korea’s Hyundai Daesan Refinery complex to deliver a strong message to cut plastic pollution to the world leaders gathered at the nearby city of Busan for the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (#INC5) to negotiate a UN Global Plastics Treaty. Help us request for the legal processes to be completed quickly so our activists - #INC5Warriors - can rejoin their loved ones as soon as possible! Your signature will be delivered to the prosecutor and the judge overseeing our ongoing case in South Korea. We’re grateful for each and every one of your support.Add your voice via link in bio ⬆️⬆️#Greenpeace

📢 GOOD NEWS 📢⁣Seychelles has just become the fourth country to ratify the Global Ocean Treaty!⁣The historic Treaty is a powerful tool for governments to create global ocean sanctuaries🐋🐠🪸 but it can only come to life at sea once at least 60 governments have written it into their national laws. This must happen before the UN Ocean Conference in June 2025. We still have a long way to go so urge your government to urgently ratify the Treaty in order to protect at least 30% of the ocean by 2030. Sign the petition check the link in our bio. ⁣⁣#ProtectTheOceans⁣

“I dont understand why you celebrate extractivism this lethal business that takes the health and lives of millions of people.”⁣⁣Celia volunteer activist with greenpeace_esp has spoken at the repsol shareholders meeting to denounce that their obscene profits come from destroying the climate and biodiversity.⁣⁣REPSOL is guilty of fuelling the climate emergency: they shouldnt profit from it they MUST PAY FOR IT!⁣⁣The only way to reach a livable future is to stop extracting and selling oil and fossil gas.⁣⁣#StopFossilGas ⁣#StopDrillingStartPaying

Did you know close to $7 TRILLION is invested globally each year in activities that harm our natural world? ⁣⁣Thats about 7% of global GDP! This is contributing to the imminent extinction of around 1 MILLION ANIMAL AND PLANT SPECIES within mere decades—more than ever before in human history.⁣⁣The planetary boundaries framework developed by the Stockholm Resilience Centre identifies nine critical processes for Earths stability. Their 2023 research reveals that weve broken 6 out of 9 of these boundaries. The Earth is now well outside of the safe operating space for humanity.⁣⁣Governments must hold banks and corporations accountable and reform our financial sector ⚠️ Tap the link in our Instagram bio to join us in calling for an end to funding nature destruction.⁣⁣#DefundNatureDestruction #Nature #Sustainability

🔥 Indonesia’s peatlands are on fire - both literally and figuratively.⁣⁣GreenpeaceIDs Forest Fires Prevention Team was formed after the catastrophic 2015 fires and haze blanketed Southeast Asia. Today they fight back on every front restoring hope and helping protect these vital lands that store up to 57 gigatons of carbon and shelter iconic wildlife like orangutans and tigers.⁣⁣Meet Rizky Prasitha a member of this remarkable team as he shares why he risks it all to save Indonesia’s peatlands. His mission is one of hope courage and commitment to protecting our planet. Watch his story via the link in bio 🔗👆⁣⁣🌎 Send your #HopeforNature to leaders at #COP16! Join us to advocate to #DefundNatureDestruction and demand real action to meet the Global Biodiversity Framework goals so we can stop this #WorldOnFire!

🚨 The WORST place in the world to drill for oil 🚨⁣⁣Conkouati-Douli National Park a UNESCO-recognised coastal national park the most biodiverse protected area in the Republic of Congo is under threat from a new oil exploration permit.⁣⁣⁣⁣7000 people depend on the park for their livelihoods.⁣⁣⁣⁣This vital ecosystem is home to endangered species like chimpanzees Western lowland gorillas forest elephants and leatherback turtles.⁣⁣⁣⁣Tap the link in our Instagram bio to join us in demanding the immediate cancellation of this ecocidal oil permit!⁣⁣via greenpeaceafrica⁣⁣#SaveCongoRainforest #Congo #oil #ConkouatiDouli #StopDrillingStartPaying #ClimateCrisis #BiodiversityCrisis

A world without emperor penguins 🐧🐧 is just too sad to imagine 😭😭 but a brand-new report highlights this shocking possibility. ⁣.⁣When penguin chicks hatch they’re not able to swim as they don’t have their waterproof feathers yet but climate change is causing the sea ice to melt earlier in the year which causes the tiny chicks to drown if the ice gives way beneath them 😲😲⁣.⁣The ocean provides a buffer against impacts from the climate crisis but that comes at a huge cost to the ocean itself causing its health to drastically decline.⁣.⁣So will we safeguard the oceans by drastically reducing our emissions and urging governments to create ocean sanctuaries to protect at least 30% of the oceans by 2030? The Global Ocean Treaty enables governments to do this but it will only come to life at sea once at least 60 governments have ratified it. ⁣.⁣Tell your government to ratify the Treaty NOW!👉⁣.⁣Sign the petition 👉👉 LINK IN BIO⁣And check out the report In Hotter Water: How the Global Ocean Treaty can boost climate action on our website.⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#ProtectTheOceans⁣

Norway’s deep sea mining plans in the Arctic are not a-peeling🍌⁣⁣In the Arctic a banana-shaped region - that is about the size of the UK - is under threat from deep sea mining.⁣⁣This could cause irreversible damage to the fragile untouched ecosystem. The deep sea in the Arctic is largely unexplored so species could be lost here before they have even been discovered!⁣⁣The Norwegian Prime Minister jonasgahrs needs to scrap his dangerous plans and make the right choice to protect the oceans for current and future generations. Sign the petition if you agree ✊⁣⁣#StopDeepSeaMining

Greenpeace hopes that the start of today’s fragile Lebanon ceasefire agreement can mark a turning point in the brutal conflict that has taken so many innocent lives.⁣⁣Today must become the anchor point for de-escalation and an unconditional comprehensive and permanent ceasefire throughout the Middle East! ⁣⁣After 416 days of violence the humanitarian and environmental devastation is unbearable.⁣⁣The bullets and bombs must also fall silent in Gaza.⁣⁣It is time for a massive and unhindered humanitarian relief effort and peaceful negotiations towards a lasting peace built on safety justice and equal rights for all. International law must be upheld.⁣⁣We call on Hamas to immediately release all hostages. We call for the Israeli Government to immediately end the blockades on the supply of food water medicine and fuel to the people of Gaza and release all illegally detained civilians.⁣⁣Greenpeace calls for a global embargo on all arms sales and transfers that could be used to further increase the toll of war crimes to be answered by both sides once this war and conflict ends.⁣⁣Greenpeace recognises the deep historic roots that need to be discussed and negotiated if a permanent peace is to be established. Greenpeace calls for an end to the illegal occupation of Palestine. Greenpeace supports the UNSC Resolution ambition that “Israel and Palestine live side by side in peace within secure and recognised borders consistent with international law and relevant UN resolutions.⁣⁣#CeasefireNow

🌳A WN IN THE AMAZON🌳⁣⁣It’s time to celebrate a historic and profound victory! The Munduruku People have been fighting for the rights to Sawré Muybu an Indigenous Land located in the Tapajós River Basin in the heart of the Amazon rainforest in Brazil. After almost 20 years of struggle the Sawré Muybu territory was officially demarcated.⁣⁣The demarcation of Sawré Muybu is a victory that transcends borders. It reinforces the idea that we can protect the Amazon with persistence and solidarity. More than ever we have reason to celebrate and continue the fight. Sawé!

Ok we’re joking. But Big Oil isn’t. Around the world Big Oil is trying to censor environmental movements with lawsuits that bankrupt activists into silence. ⁣⁣Lawsuits like the one Energy Transfer is currently taking out against Greenpeace International and Greenpeace in the USA for US$300 million. ⁣⁣We don’t think that Big Oil has any business telling us what we are allowed to say. VICTORY!⁣Today’s groundbreaking Advisory Opinion by the International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea confirms it: Greenhouse gases harm our oceans. States must reduce GHGs to protect our seas safeguard communities and preserve biodiversity.⁣The ruling highlights the urgent need for action on climate change to protect our oceans. To do so governments must phase out fossil fuels and protect marine biodiversity. The health of our oceans is vital for the well-being of all forms of life.⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#ITLOSAO #ClimateJustice #ProtectOurOceans⁣

Have you ever plunged into the Antarctic Ocean depths in a small submarine to marvel at the breathtaking marine life we don’t often get to see?⁣⁣Most people haven’t been that lucky😭⁣ ⁣But if you watch Polar Abyss you’ll be able to explore the mysterious worlds that remain hidden beneath the Antarctic and Arctic Oceans 🌊⁣⁣This is one of the short film companions to the major new documentary series Our Oceans now on Netflix.⁣⁣All the episodes aim to highlight the various connections we share with the oceans–whether it’s through the air we breathe or the food we eat because all life on Earth depends on the oceans💙⁣⁣#ProtectTheOceans

🚨 BREAKING 🚨⁣⁣After a historic win earlier this year GreenpeaceNorge and NaturogUngdom are facing the Norwegian government in Court again in an effort to immediately halt the ongoing development of three illegal oil fields.⁣⁣In January an Oslo District Court ruling invalidated the previous approvals of these projects for lack of impact assessments of global climate effects. They also issued orders restraining any new permits for the fields ⁣⁣Since then the Norwegian state has appealed the decisions and ignored the injunctions.⁣⁣Taking ambitious action to address the climate emergency is a duty of states and not some favour to communities. This case is part of a movement where people across the world are holding to account those responsible for the climate and nature crises which affect fundamental human rights. ✊⁣⁣#ClimateJustice ⁣

📸 Capturing Costa Ricas Conservation Triumph 🌿 ⁣⁣Did you hear of  Costa Ricas remarkable journey towards environmental sustainability? By eliminating environmentally harmful subsidies that encouraged activities such as cattle ranching Costa Rica achieved an astounding 80% reduction in deforestation rates! 🌍 ⁣⁣Could this be a role model for other regions? 🚨 GREENWASHING ALERT 🚨 ⁣⁣Oil and chemical companies who created ‘The Alliance to END Plastic Waste’ have produced 1000x MORE NEW PLASTIC in five years than the waste they cleaned up according to a Greenpeace Unearthed investigation.⁣⁣⁣Faulty recycling schemes like these barely make a dent in the mountain of waste these companies produce. It’s hard to imagine a clearer example of greenwashing 🤡⁣⁣⁣⁣The solution is simple: We must REDUCE plastic production at its source. The world needs a strong #PlasticsTreaty that CAPS production. No more excuses. ⁣⁣Go to the link in our Instagram bio to sign the petition to demand real action NOW.⁣⁣#unearthed #greenpeace #investigation #singleuseplastic #plasticcrisis #recycling #greenwashing

A dozen South Sumatran residents attended Palembang District Court this morning to register a lawsuit against three plantation companies over the chronic smoke haze that has blighted their lives due to fires repeatedly burning on peatland inside the companies’ concession areas. The three companies named in the lawsuit are PT Bumi Mekar Hijau (BMH) PT Bumi Andalas Permai (BAP) and PT Sebangun Bumi Andalas Wood Industries (SBA Wood Industries).⁣⁣“The drainage and destruction of peatlands in these areas which subsequently leads to out-of-control forest fires and haze severely exacerbates the climate crisis. The increase in carbon emissions due to forest fires and haze also undermines emissions reduction efforts jeopardizing the achievement of Indonesia’s climate targets” said greenpeaceID Forest Campaigner Belgis Habiba.⁣⁣Supported by a coalition of civil society and environmental organisations called the South Sumatra Smoke Suit Initiative (Inisiasi Sumatera Selatan Penggugat Asap – ISSPA) the twelve residents are asking the court to award compensation for the deprivation of their right to a healthy environment and for environmental restoration after the fires which have harmed them both materially and immaterially.⁣⁣#RightToCleanAir #ActOnClimate #AirPollution #ClimateCrisis

📢📢NEWS WORTH CELEBRATING🥳🥳⁣The EU Parliament just voted to ratify the Global Ocean Treaty 🎉 🎉 ⁣With a significant majority of 556 to 36 the EU vote could inspire others to ratify. ⁣At present only four countries have ratified the Treaty – Palau Chile Belize and Seychelles. Its now up to the 27 EU member states to follow in their footsteps and urgently ratify the Treaty before the next UN Ocean Conference in June 2025. This will enable governments to cover the ocean in a network of sanctuaries and to protect at least 30% of the global ocean by 2030. ⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#ProtectTheOceans⁣

Greenpeace activists in more than 15 cities around the world are expressing solidarity against the abusive legal tactics of US-based fossil fuel company Energy TransferLP (ET) during two sustained global weeks of action. Greenpeace International (GPI) and the Greenpeace entities in the US are currently defending against a meritless US$ 300 million lawsuit from ET related to the Indigenous-led protests against the Dakota Access Pipeline in 2016. From Paris to Indonesia this global week of action sends a clear message: “We will not be silenced!”⁣⁣Globally more and more corporations are using dirty legal tricks like SLAPP suits to intimidate and silence their critics. Hundreds of SLAPPs spanning every continent are currently in progress. This case brought by Energy Transfer is one of the most egregious and if it goes unanswered it will embolden other companies to do the same. ⁣⁣Check the link in our bio to sign a petition that tells Energy Transfer and all corporate bullies: I am with Greenpeace!

Trigger Warning: Graphic Animal Content ⚠️🔥 “Every rescue is 50/50 so I have a 50% chance of failure” 🔥Paula’s reality is unfortunately one of many. Her daily fight to save wild animals in Brazil’s burning Pantanal is shaped by a combination between climate change and criminal fires often initiated by the agriculture sector.The agricultural sector along with banks and investors remains largely unaccountable for the severe environmental and social impacts of their actions. Despite the immense harm caused including loss of biodiversity and increased greenhouse gas emissions there is insufficient scrutiny on how hundreds of millions of dollars in loans and investments contribute to the destruction of natural ecosystems.According to a recent MapBiomas Águas survey the Pantanal’s water surface has shrunk by 61% since 1985. In 2020 fires tragically claimed the lives of 17 million animals including 1.5 million birds and 458000 primates as reported in the 2021 study “Wildfire in the Pantanal: Impacts and Management Challenges”.As we approach the UN Biodiversity COP16 in Cali Colombia let’s raise our voices. Join us in sending a message of #HopeForNature to political leaders and demand them to act for nature including properly regulating financial flows that enable an endless destruction!📢 Click the link in our bio to learn more and take action. Share Paula’s story because together we can protect these vital ecosystems 💪#WorldOnFire #DefundNatureDestruction📽️ outcastfilm_ StudioBirthplace rob_natali

Just because natural gas has the word ‘natural’ in it doesn’t mean that it is safe for the planet the people and the climate. ⁣⁣1. Gas is already responsible for 22% of global greenhouse gas emissions from fossil fuel combustion.⁣⁣2. Fossil fuel extraction is responsible for tremendous social impacts and human rights violations in Global Majority countries.⁣⁣3. Gas exploration and gas infrastructure such as platforms and pipelines are particularly damaging to nature: deforestation release of harmful pollutants noise from seismic surveys that endanger whales and dolphins…⁣⁣4. Recent studies suggest that gas stoves put people at greater risk of respiratory disease than previously thought. Recent estimates put the number of deaths from fossil fuel air pollution at 5 million per year. ⁣⁣5. Explosions fires and earthquakes are common events in the gas business at every step of the supply chain.⁣⁣Read more about it here ➡️ act.gp/whygasisbad ⁣⁣#StopFossilGas #SaveThePlanet #Earth #Green #GoGreen #ClimateChange⁣

Greenpeace activists in more than 15 cities around the world are expressing solidarity against the abusive legal tactics of US-based fossil fuel company EnergyTransferLP (ET) during two sustained global weeks of action. Greenpeace International (GPI) and the Greenpeace entities in the US are currently defending against a meritless US$ 300 million lawsuit from ET related to the Indigenous-led protests against the Dakota Access Pipeline in 2016. From the Amazon to the Philippines this global week of action sends a clear message: “We will not be silenced!”⁣⁣Globally more and more corporations are using dirty legal tricks like SLAPP suits to intimidate and silence their critics. Hundreds of SLAPPs spanning every continent are currently in progress. This case brought by Energy Transfer is one of the most egregious and if it goes unanswered it will embolden other companies to do the same. ⁣⁣Check the link in our bio to learn more about the growing solidarity against corporate bullies like Energy Transfer!

What is carbon footprint and where does it come from?⁣The greenpeaceships crew has a clue! ⁣⁣The concept of carbon footprint was born as one indicator of our impact on the Earth. However the idea really took off in 2003 when the oil and gas company BP launched a campaign.⁣⁣It was a clever trick on their part as they pushed corporate guilt onto us personally while they carried on drilling for fossil fuels! ⁣⁣So what if carbon footprint came to life for a little revenge in the form of an animation?⁣⁣If youre curious check out our link in bio ⬆️⬆️⁣⁣#Animation #MyPetFootprint #Comedy #Cartoon #Greenpeace⁣

ICYMI: On 30 November 2024 4 Greenpeace activists boarded a tanker that was about to load toxic plastic chemicals from South Korea’s Hyundai Daesan Refinery complex to deliver a strong message to cut plastic pollution to the world leaders gathered at the nearby city of Busan for the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (#INC5) to negotiate a UN Global Plastics Treaty. ⁣⁣Fast forward 2.5 months later Al - one of the 4 activists - decided to pen their own story in their own voice from their own perspective. The 4 activists unable to leave the country continue to reside in Korea as they undergo their investigation for the peaceful direct action that took place in Daesen city as a part of the ‘Sailing for Change: Plastic Free Future’ Rainbow Warrior ship tour in East Asia.⁣⁣For Al’s story check our link in bio. ⁣⁣#INC5Warriors #Greenpeace⁣

Do you know what #COP29 is?⁣⁣As COP29 is approaching world leaders will gather from Monday 11 November to Friday 22 November in Baku Azerbaijan – yet another country with fossil fuel interests – at the 29th annual climate negotiations.⁣⁣Since the world experiences month after month of record temperatures and we move closer and closer to the global heating limit set out in the Paris Agreement we need real firm action at COP29 to limit global heating to 1.5°C.⁣⁣Find out what you need to know about the annual global climate summit👆

Who will explain to our children that in the middle of the climate crisis greedy corporations and complicit governments just kept building more destructive fossil gas infrastructure?⁣⁣OMV Petroms Neptun Deep project in the Black Sea could cause tens of thousands temperature-related premature deaths by the end of the century: An estimated 46000 people worldwide could die prematurely before 2100 due to extreme temperatures caused by Neptun Deep according to an expert analysis prepared for  greenpeace_romania. ⁣⁣But: We can still stop Neptun Deep!⁣⁣Fossil fuels are destroying our future. The concept of Mind Bombs centers on using powerful stories to change the world rather than actual bombs. It was first coined by Bob Hunter during the 1970s Anti-Whaling Campaign where Greenpeace activists set out to photograph the damages caused by commercial whaling in the North Pacific. These photos by Rex Weyler showed the world the devastating deaths of numerous whales done for the sake of profit. This non-violent action greatly influenced the International Whaling Committee to put a moratorium on commercial whaling in 1982 and a total ban in 1985.Source: BBC#whales #ClimateAction #oceans #photography

BREAKING: 18 Greenpeace activists from Germany and the Netherlands are currently at sea protesting the installation of a gas extraction platform belonging to the Dutch energy company ONE-Dyas.The greenpeace.de and greenpeacenl activists have anchored three floating islands at the destination of the production platform which is expected to arrive. Other activists are demonstrating in rubber dinghies and kayaks for the protection of the Wadden Sea their flags and banners bearing the slogans “Gas destroys!” and “No New Gas”.#StopDrillingStartPaying#FossilFreeFuture

Have you ever wondered what the experience is like for the fishers who catch the fish that ends up on supermarket shelves around the world? 🐟Illegal unreported and unregulated (IUU) fishing is one of the most serious threats to our oceans’ health and covers any activity that contravenes the law including human slavery. .On the upcoming International Day for the Fight against IUU Fishing we highlight why we need to protect the ocean and #EndModernSlaveryatSEA...#StopIUUFishing

The Arctic is already facing too many threats. We won’t let Norway start deep sea mining in this fragile region. Join us and send an email to the Norwegian Prime Minister to demand a halt to this dangerous plans: link in bio!⁣⁣#StopDeepSeaMining #greenpeace #Arctic #deepseamining #ProtectTheOceans

Obsession with growth and productivity has made us forget what’s truly important in life.GDP (Gross Domestic Product) which has long been the main metric of economic success fails to respect planetary boundaries and human needs causing the polycrisis we’re facing today. Through art installations in collaboration with the Jakarta Art Institute greenpeaceid redefines the meaning of what makes our lives worth living and our planet more hospitable and find the true hidden gems in life. These installations are also aimed as a call to go beyond GDP during the UN Summit of the Future.“Greenpeace believes that wellbeing can’t be measured with just numbers. Life is much more complex as we need other things like the environment quality and affordable education families and also a good and fair government for the wellbeing of the people and planet” said Rahka Susanto greenpeaceid Project Lead.

A devastating tornado recently ripped through KwaZulu-Natal South Africa killing 12 people and displacing 1500.⁣⁣Our thoughts are with everybody impacted. 💚⁣⁣Burning fossil fuels is making extreme weather more frequent and more SEVERE. ⁣⁣Its time to demand big oil #StopDrillingStartPaying add your name at link in bio Greenpeace

You know how annoying it is when you can’t get a signal right? 📶But spare a thought for those working far out at sea - there’s simply no signal on our oceans.In August the Rainbow Warrior sailed from Taiwan to Hawai’i and shared its WiFi with migrant fishers on distant water fishing vessels along the way.Improving WiFi coverage in international waters would improve both the wellbeing and the safety and protection for people in some of the world’s most dangerous jobs. It would also serve to increase transparency regarding illegal fishing practices.Help us increase the coverage this #WorldFisheriesDay!

In the heart of Bangsal village South Sumatra Indonesia a rich tapestry of culture and tradition is under threat from smoke haze linked to devastating peatland fires ignited by corporate plantations.⁣⁣Did you know? Indonesia’s tropical peatlands are a biodiversity hotspot home to magnificent creatures like orangutans and tigers! Yet these vibrant ecosystems are being drained for palm oil and pulpwood turning lush landscapes into fire-prone zones. 💔 ⁣⁣Together we rise for justice! Let’s unite in solidarity with the courageous residents of Bangsal as they fight to safeguard their rich culture and environment from the grasp of corporate greed and share your message of #HopeForNature with world leaders at the UN Biodiversity COP16.⁣⁣Watch the full video via link in bio! 👆⁣⁣#WorldOnFire #DefundNatureDestructionNow⁣

Sign the petition: link 🔗 in bio ⁣⁣#StopDeepSeaMining #ProtectTheOceans

40 years ago the Rainbow Warrior took part in a historic event on the Marshall Islands - a massive relocation effort to help evacuate the people of Rongelap to Mejatto due to decades of US government nuclear weapons testing.⁣.⁣They say we rescued them from a contaminated #Rongelap but the reality is that they rescued themselves - the Marshallese are the strong and brave people who took their future into their own hands and continue to do so. ⁣.⁣We cannot relocate the world — it is only through standing and acting together that we will make the needed difference that saves us all. In the fight for justice our voices will not be silenced.⁣Jimwe im Maron - Justice!⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#MarshallIslands #NuclearJustice  #History #JusticeforMarshallIslands #ClimateJustice #JimweImMaron⁣

From the 🌊Great Pacific Garbage Patch to microplastic sampling off Colombia Greenpeace has sailed our ships all over the 🌏 to expose the plastic crisis.⁣⁣In November world leaders will gather in Busan Korea 🇰🇷 towards a once-in-a-generation solution — a Global #PlasticsTreaty. And we’re bringing the iconic Rainbow Warrior with us.⁣⁣Stay tuned as we set sail across East Asia to demand world leaders deliver a strong treaty that cuts plastic production. And if you’re in Hong Kong Taiwan or Korea watch this space to find out how you can take part!⁣⁣☝️Tap the link in our Instagram bio to help tackle plastic pollution with us!⁣⁣#Plastics #BreakFreeFromPlastic #ClimateCrisis #FossilFuels #EndOil #plasticpollution #realsolutions #plasticfree #zerowaste #Reuse #Refill #INC5 #RainbowWarrior

Yes the emissions from meat and dairy giants rival those of fossil fuel companies.⁣⁣A Greenpeace Nordic report released a few months ago revealed that JBS the worlds largest meat producer would rank 5th if put on a list alongside the reportedly biggest methane emitting corporations and rivals the methane emissions reported for major oil companies ExxonMobil and Shell combined.⁣⁣We urgently need to put an end to the overproduction and overconsumption of industrial meat and dairy. We must reject ever-larger factory farms—cruel polluting and destructive—and push for a massive shift towards more plant-based diets wherever possible. We must also expose and reject the misleading marketing tactics of the industry which does everything it can to slow the decline in meat and dairy consumption and delay this vital transition.⁣⁣A few months ago Greenpeace activists from several countries took action outside the headquarters of major companies in the sector. They were there to remind us that we can and must meaningfully slow climate breakdown within our lifetime by transitioning to a just food system—one that moves away from industrial meat and dairy production and promotes plant-based alternatives and call on governments to act urgently to support this transition.⁣⁣📸 © IATP / Bryce Groves / Jana Eriksson / Michael Hedelain / Greenpeace⁣⁣⁣#climatecrisis #meatanddairy #lessmeatlessheat #stopfactoryfarming #plantbased

All we need is hope AND ACTION 📣 from world leaders to bring commitments to protect and restore nature to life. 🤷‍♀️⁣⁣Right before UN Biodiversity #COP16 started in Cali Colombia activists around the globe projected a stunning visual story transforming urgency into hope 💚 They highlighted the impact of destructive industries and celebrated messages of restoration sent in by people from every corner of the world ❗⁣⁣Imagine seeing that transformation in ✨real life.✨ The urgency is real - heat waves floods and fires are scorching our planet and the collapse of biodiversity threatens our very existence. And wouldn’t it be incredible if the US$7 trillion (UNEP) that banks and corporations currently fueling said activities harming our planet were redirected to reparations and positive change instead? 👀⁣⁣#HopeForNature #DefundNatureDestruction #RestoreNature #COP16 #PeaceWithNature

🚨ACTION ALERT🚨⁣⁣⁣Over the last 24 hours Greenpeace activists from a number of countries have paid a visit to some of the worlds meat and dairy giants. ⁣⁣Industrial meat and dairy products are leaving a trail of destruction around the world.⁣⁣If we put a brake on Big Meat and Dairy corporations curbing the unrestrained growth of their factory farms and the emissions they produce—particularly methane which is driving climate chaos—and make a massive switch to more plant-based diets wherever possible we can slow down global heating within this decade!⁣⁣Tap the link in our Instagram bio to join the movement ✊⁣⁣📸: © Bryce Groves / Jana Eriksson / Michael Hedelain / Greenpeace⁣⁣#meat #dairy #stopfactoryfarming #climatecrisis #methane  #makemethanevisible #greenpeace
Together we can - and will -  fight for a more green and just planet for all ✊

As climate change threatens to unravel the fabric of life across Oceania the many peoples of the Pacific have been fighting back since 2019. ⁣⁣Due to the monumental efforts of the coalition of Pacific groups International Court of Justice (ICJ CIJ_ICJ) will soon weigh in on the legal obligations of countries to act on climate change.⁣⁣This historic hearing will take place at the Peace Palace in The Hague Netherlands. Legal teams and international organisations from over 100 countries will debate the obligations of countries to protect our planet and the people. ⁣⁣You can show your solidarity with those most impacted by the climate emergency and help amplify their testimonies before and during the ICJ hearings this December. ⁣⁣For more information on how to get involved and for regular #ICJAO updates follow pisfcc and blueoceanlaw.⁣⁣#AllRiseForClimateJustice #Greenpeace

NO OLYMPICS ON A DEAD PLANET!This year’s Olympics in Paris had been hailed as the “Green Games” yet their major sponsor Toyota has higher CO2 emissions than the entire country of France and according to the New Weather Institute has the highest annual emissions among all the sponsors.We are calling on Toyota to cut carbon emissions by:1. Aligning their business plans with the Paris Climate Agreement.2. Commiting to globally stop selling new fossil fuel vehicles including hybrids by 2030 at the latest.3. Stopping their attempts to water down climate policies and targets across the world.Sign Greenpeace East Asia’s open letter in bio🔗#ParisOlympics #Paris2024 #Olympics #Toyota #DriveChange #ZeroEmission #ActCnClimate

“Im Ash. ⁣⁣Last November during #INC5 hosted in Busan city we boarded a gas tanker as part of a peaceful protest to send a strong message about global plastic pollution and as a result I along with my fellow activists Al Sam Jens and Captain Hettie have been prohibited from leaving South Korea under the orders of the Minister of Justice.⁣⁣During this time of being unable to leave the country I received the heartbreaking news of my grandmother’s passing. Because of this travel restriction I was unable to attend her funeral. This has left me feeling deeply saddened as I am stuck in Korea waiting for the legal proceedings to conclude with no end in sight unable to grieve alongside my family.⁣⁣2 months later we are still in Korea waiting for the legal process to unfold. So far no specific timeline has been provided by the Korean judiciary—it has been just an endless uncertain wait for the 5 of us.⁣⁣As the Lunar New Year approaches a time in Asia that traditionally symbolizes family reunions the 5 of us remain in Korea carrying the weight of longing for our loved ones and the hopes of our families awaiting our return. ⁣⁣Please sign the petition to help us end this legal process faster so that we may return home to our families soon.” ⁣⁣- Ash Greenpeace activist ⁣⁣Photo by Taekyoung Jung⁣⁣#INC5Warriors #Greenpeace

From the main bridge leading to Nusantara the new captital city of Indonesia in East Kalimantan GreenpeaceID activists unfurled a long banner in the colours of the national flag reading “Indonesia is not for sale: Merdeka! (Freedom!)” when commemorating the countrys Independence Day this past weekend. The development of Nusantara impacts on Indigenous land rights forests and wildlife. Environment is degraded Indigenous people and local communities are evicted from their land even criminalised when struggling to find their home.The future Indonesian government must immediately act to stop deforestation and preserve the biodiversity to implement solutions to ensure that the country remains livable for the people.#IndonesiaIsNotForSaleMerdeka #Indonesia #ClimateJustice #SocialJustice #ClimateCrisis

Climate crisis is a BURNING issue - literally.Right now G20 leaders are meeting in South Africa to find solutions to global economic and financial issues. But they must face reality: the climate crisis and skyrocketing inequality are twin emergencies demanding urgent action.Taxing the ultra-rich is not just an option—it’s a necessity. The revenue must be used to fight poverty protect the most vulnerable and communities hit hardest by climate disasters and fund a just transition.Global tax rules are still controlled by a small clique of wealthy countries allowing billionaires and corporations to shift profits and dodge taxes. For too long this system has let the super-rich hoard wealth while those most affected by the climate and social crises pay the price. It’s a moral outrage.Greenpeace and many others are fighting to make taxing the super-rich a global reality. Join the movement! Tap the link in our bio.#TaxTheSuperRich #FightInequality #LivesBeforeProfits #ClimateCrisis #ClimateBreakdown #ExtremeWeather #ClimateDisasters

🌍✨ Greenpeace Pictures of the Week ✨🌿⁣⁣⁣This week we’ve witnessed inspiring moments from around the globe. Students in Indonesia learned about tackling forest fires while Bulgaria focused on Black Sea conservation efforts. In the Philippines typhoon survivors rallied for change and at the UK Parliament a bid to protect the Sargasso Sea was launched. Meanwhile activists in Germany displayed a giant CO2 symbol highlighting the risks of carbon capture plans. Not to mention a march for clean water in the UK and solidarity action in Greece challenging oil and gas corporations attempts to silence civil society around the world.⁣⁣Swipe left to discover our best photographs from the past seven days. ⁣Join us in spreading the message of environmental advocacy! 💚🌱⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#Greenpeace #PicsOfTheWeek #ClimateAction #ProtectTheOceans #BreakFreeFromPlastic #Nature #PeoplePower #BiodiversityOverBanks #IndigenousRights #RainbowWarrior

Communities are leading climate action ✊ ⁣⁣Members of the El Bosque community from Tabasco Mexico are speaking today before the Inter-American Court of Human Rights (IACtHR) in Manaus Brazil to demand climate justice! 🌍💬 ⁣ ⁣For over five years the El Bosque community has experienced the severe impacts of the climate crisis. Over 60 families have been displaced by sea level rise and coastal erosion. The Advisory Opinion from the IACtHR could clarify the obligations of States and corporations under international and human rights law. ⁣⁣Impacted communities civil society organisations scientists and academics are sharing their demands at the IACtHR. This journey started through the advice requested by Colombia and Chile on States’ human rights obligations in the context of the #ClimateEmergency.⁣⁣Go to the link in our bio to learn more about this pivotal process and why the leadership and activism of the communities is essential!⁣📸: Gustavo Graf/Greenpeace.⁣#ClimateJustice #IACtHR #CorteIDH⁣

Governments are meeting at the United Nations HQ in New York City this week on the UN Ocean Treaty for the first time since the treaty opened for signatures in September 2023. ⁣.⁣So far seven countries have ratified the Global Ocean Treaty (Palau Chile Belize Seychelles Monaco Mauritius Federated States of Micronesia) but leaders serious about ocean protection have a lot of work to do this week to bring the Treaty to life at sea.

EXPOSED: toxic history behind a tragic mining accident.⁣⁣In February a cyanide-laced landslide at İliç Mine in Turkey claimed nine lives. Investigation reveals lax oversight and systemic failure. ⁣⁣Greenpeace demands accountability and transparency to prevent future disasters. ⁣⁣Read more in our latest blog. Link in our bio.

All this destruction—for GOLD.⁣⁣Illegal gold mining in the Amazon isn’t just destroying forests. It’s poisoning rivers wildlife and Indigenous communities. Mercury used to extract gold is now in the food chain—found in fish animals and people. In some Yanomami villages—an Indigenous people living deep in the Amazon—84% of residents are contaminated.⁣⁣This is toxic deadly and entirely preventable. At #COP30 in November leaders must act to end the toxic gold trade and protect the Amazon—for good.⁣⁣If not now WHEN?⁣⁣✊ Go to act.gp/RespectTheAmazon to add your voice⁣⁣#RespectTheAmazon #ToxicGold #Amazon #BiodiversityCrisis #ClimateCrisis #IndigenousRights #IndigenousPeoples

Deep sea mining would be a disaster for people in Pacific Island nations like the Cook Islands who rely on the oceans everyday. Greedy companies want to exploit the Pacific Ocean without any regard for Pasifika people’s way of life and traditions that have been shaped by the oceans for thousands of years.But there’s hope: activists and organisations like te_ipukarea_society are standing up and fighting back - share this video to amplify the message.#StopDeepSeaMining #ocean #climatechange

The Fight for Alternatives Global Assembly hosted by fightinequality has kicked off in Manila Philippines today. Human rights defenders climate activists  trade unionists artists academics and like-minded individuals from around the world are gathering to discuss solutions to inequality and how to build an economic system that prioritizes people and the planet. We’re here at the event and will share highlights in the coming days!As the assembly begins we’re reminded of the harsh realities the majority world faces today. With the worsening climate crisis already vulnerable countries like the Philippines are becoming even more susceptible to disasters. Earlier this week Typhoon Yagi caused flooding and landslides in several provinces displacing thousands and devastating livelihoods. This cycle of destruction must end. We need an economic system that prioritizes the well-being of all over financial gain.1. Participants getting to know each other as part of the opening ceremony.2. Greenpeace collaborated with Filipino mural artist AG Saño on an immersive ‘street art’ experience uncovering the Hidden Gems Generation. More on this later this week until then: flip the image for some treasures! )3. United in the fight against inequality. 4. Lidy Nacpil Filipino human rights environmental gender and social justice activist shared powerful words during the opening ceremony.5. Starting the day with these incredible Ati-Atihan drummers. Way to kick off the Assembly! Photos by Jilson Tiu/Greenpeace#WellbeingEconomy #SystemsChange #climatechange #economy

😔 Loneliness has emerged as a significant global public health concern*. It even gets worse in the cities.Our crowded but isolating cities have become a clear manifestation of a system that prioritises profit consumption and individualism. Add polarisation constant bad news increasing conflict and climate anxiety it’s easy to feel hopeless.However cities have also been the birthplace of powerful social movements throughout history. They all start with people coming together breaking down isolation and creating a sense of purpose while driving real change in the making. 🙏💪In the new episode of #SystemShift podcast we speak to souamandacosta a climate activist who is passionate about communities and collective power especially with favelas in Brazil 🇧🇷🎧 🎥 Listen/watch the full episode ‘Are Urban Communities a Remedy for Loneliness?’ via the link in our bio 👆😊*Source: WHO 2023

Did you know that most protected areas aren’t actually protected at all?😱⁣.⁣Our new report From Commitment to Action: Achieving the 30X30 Target Through the Global Ocean Treaty shows only 0.9% of the global oceans are completely off limits to destructive human activities.⁣.⁣This means many precious marine ecosystems remain vulnerable to highly damaging fishing practices like bottom trawling and longlining 🤯⁣.⁣The Global Ocean Treaty gives governments the power to create a network of global ocean sanctuaries that will help marine life recover and thrive - but it can only come to life at sea once at least 60 governments have ratified it. ⁣.⁣If governments are serious about protecting at least 30% of the oceans by 2030 they MUST ratify the Treaty NOW. ⁣Go to our LINK 🔗 IN BIO to sign the petition!⁣.⁣#ProtectTheOceans

A community worker tells her experience of Super Typhoon #Gaemi and the impossible reality that many frontline communities in the Philippines have had to live with because of the worsening climate crisis.⁣⁣With the intervals between extreme weather events getting shorter their climate resilience efforts simply can’t keep up. Those most responsible for climate change should answer for this. ⁣⁣#MakePollutersPay⁣#ClimateJusticeNow⁣

BREAKING: Greenpeace International filed a landmark lawsuit in Dutch court against US-based fossil fuel pipeline company Energy Transfer today in the first test of the European Union’s anti-SLAPP Directive. ⁣⁣#WeWillNotBeSilenced!⁣⁣Energy Transfer’s meritless US$300 million suit against Greenpeace International and Greenpeace in the US is one of the world’s most brazen examples of a Strategic Lawsuit Against Public Participation (SLAPP) — and we’re fighting back! ⁣⁣Greenpeace Internationals lawsuit filed in Dutch court against Energy Transfer seeks to recover all damages and costs it has suffered as a result of this Big Oil company’s back-to-back meritless lawsuits demanding hundreds of millions of dollars against GPI and the Greenpeace entities in the United States. ⁣⁣Check the link in our bio to let Energy Transfer and all Big Oil bullies know that #ImWithGreenpeace

We need your help!⁣⁣Greenpeace International activists - Al Ash Jens Sam and Rainbow Warrior Captain Hettie - are currently prohibited from leaving South Korea. They are under an ongoing investigation for the peaceful direct action that took place in Daesen city as a part of the ‘Sailing for Change: Plastic Free Future’ Rainbow Warrior ship tour in East Asia last year.⁣⁣ICYMI: On 30 November 2024 the 4 activists boarded a tanker that was about to load toxic plastic chemicals from South Korea’s Hyundai Daesan Refinery complex to deliver a strong message to cut plastic pollution to the world leaders gathered at the nearby city of Busan for the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (#INC5) to negotiate a UN Global Plastics Treaty. ⁣⁣Help us request for the legal processes to be completed quickly so our activists - #INC5Warriors - can rejoin their loved ones as soon as possible! Your signature will be delivered to the prosecutor and the judge overseeing our ongoing case in South Korea. ⁣⁣Sign your name via link in bio ⬆️⁣⁣#Greenpeace

While billionaires play their games 🌊🌍😢 millions of people worldwide face climate catastrophe.⁣⁣Not only does Nigeria have to deal with the devastation fossil fuel companies left behind but now they face climate impacts caused by that same industry 🥵 Both Nigeria and Central Asia face extreme heatwaves due to climate chaos driven by the oil and gas industry.⁣⁣Floods in Australia DRC South Africa and US have claimed many lives and caused so much damage to peoples homes and communities 🥺 Who pays for this devastation?⁣⁣The science is clear: extreme weather is becoming more frequent and severe across the world.⁣⁣😡 And the fossil fuel industry is driving this climate chaos.⁣⁣Demand that fossil fuel corporations are forced to stop drilling and start paying for the climate damage they’ve caused 👆 (link in bio greenpeace)⁣#stopdrillingstartpaying

Like Jay residents in the Lebung Itam Indonesia are facing the devastating impact of the smoke haze caused by peatland fires from nearby plantations 🔥 Jay lost his swiftlet (bird) house and his immediate environment turned toxic. ⁣⁣But Jay will not back down and his fellow villagers stand firm with him! ✊⁣⁣Together they have filed a lawsuit against three companies that are long-term wood suppliers to Indonesia’s agribusiness and finance conglomerate Sinar Mas. It is a tale as old as time big conglomerates get away with it all according to greenpeaceID research despite government sanctions these devastating fires occur yearly 😠⁣⁣And so…we join their fight for justice❗⁣⁣Take action today - share your message of #HopeForNature with world leaders at the UN Biodiversity COP16 and demand urgent action to protect the Amazon and our planet’s future. 🌎⁣⁣Watch the full video on YouTube to witness their powerful story! 🔗 ⁣Links in bio 👆⁣⁣#WorldOnFire #DefundNatureDestruction⁣

greenpeaceth volunteers joined local medical volunteers to deliver emergency medical supplies to flood-affected residents in Phon Pisai district Nong Khai province in Thailand. Action alert: Submit a portrait today to take action on the plastic crisis! 📷👁️⁣⁣This November world leaders could deliver a historic #PlasticsTreaty to tackle the plastic crisis.⁣⁣That’s why Greenpeace is collaborating with artist Dan Acher to kick off treaty talks with something that world leaders can’t ignore – a giant 👁️ flying over Busan South Korea to hold leaders accountable. The North Dakota Supreme Court today denied a petition by Greenpeace International and Greenpeace entities in the US for a change of venue as they defend against the SLAPP case brought by Energy Transfer in Morton County. The North Dakota Supreme Court’s denial follows three prior denied motions to the Morton County court for change of venue. ⁣⁣The fairness of a trial should be above any questioning. A jury drawn from a community heavily affected by the events Energy Transfer is attempting to blame on the defendants shouldn’t bear the responsibility of deciding this case. It’s disappointing to learn the Supreme Court denied the motion but we are confident in our defence and will continue to focus on winning at trial said Daniel Simons Senior Legal Counsel Greenpeace International.⁣⁣Check the link in our bio to learn more about Big Oil bully Energy Transfer’s SLAPP lawsuit.⁣⁣⁣⁣#WeWillNotBeSilenced

While northern China bakes under high temperatures compounded by drought cities across southern China are inundated by extended bouts of extreme rainfall.⁣⁣This year heavy rainfall and flooding has come from rainfall that is abnormally long in duration and wide range in terms of the area impacted. In an El Niño year the amount of water vapor in the atmosphere is particularly high.⁣⁣Analysis from China’s National Data Center shows that precipitation has been more than 20% higher than normal for the past ten days in most of southern China with some areas experiencing rainfall as high as twice the average. This year the amount of precipitation from April 4 to June 11 broke historical records for rainfall in southern China going back to 1961.⁣⁣The State General Administration of Flood Control initiated Level 4 Emergency Response for flood control in seven provinces including Fujian Guangxi Zhejiang Guizhou Guangdong Hunan and Jiangxi.⁣There is no more time to waste.⁣⁣Photo: CFOTO/Future Publishing via Getty Images⁣⁣ #ActOnClimate #China #Flood #ClimateChange #Greenpeace

#HiddenGemsGeneration - In a world fixated on growth and productivity we often overlook what truly matters. GDP which has long been used as a measure of economic success fails to account for planetary health and human well-being contributing to the crises we face today.⁣⁣On 19 September 2024 ahead of Koreas Youth Day in Sinchon Seoul’s vibrant youth district greenpeacekorea presented a striking visual demonstration. A 3-meter-high LED screen depicted a burning Earth while a 5-meter-long installation titled Invoice of GDP’s Unaccounted Values stood in front. This action emphasized that GDP only measures economic quantity ignoring climate impacts and the well-being of people.⁣⁣#WellbeingEconomy #WellbeingForAll #GoBeyondGDP #YouthDayKorea⁣

This years Olympics could be the hottest ever 🥵 and yet they’re sponsored by a major carbon emitter.⁣⁣In 2022 Toyota contributed to 1.5% of the world’s total carbon emissions with the cars they sold – nearly twice the annual emissions of France.⁣⁣Join us to demand Toyota to phase out fossil fuel cars and act on climate by sending an open letter now - link in bio.⁣⁣#ParisOlympics #Paris2024 #Olympics #Toyota #DriveChange #ActOnClimate

Typhoon #Gaemi has caused severe flooding in multiple parts of the Philippines where at least 12 people have died and over 600000 are displaced from their homes.And while many Filipinos are suffering through this calamity fossil fuel giants who are worsening the climate crisis are still making billions in profit.This is why we need urgent global action to force the fossil fuel industry to take accountability for the climate crisis and to #StopDrillingStartPaying.Photo by Jilson Tiu / Greenpeace#ExtremeWeather #Flood #Typhoon #Manila #Carina

On 30 November the 4 activists boarded a tanker that was about to load toxic plastic chemicals from South Korea’s Hyundai Daesan Refinery complex to deliver a strong message to cut plastic pollution to the world leaders gathered at the nearby city of Busan for the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (#INC5) to negotiate a UN Global Plastics Treaty. This was a part of the ‘Sailing for Change: Plastic Free Future’ Rainbow Warrior ship tour in East Asia.⁣⁣Fast forward over 3 months later the 4 activists and the Rainbow Warrior captain Hettie are still unable to leave the country and they continue to reside in Korea as they undergo their investigation for that peaceful direct action.⁣⁣Al - one of the activists - decided to pen her own story in her own voice from her own perspective.⁣⁣For Al’s story of their journey check our link in bio. ⁣⁣#INC5Warriors #Greenpeace

This year the French multinational oil and gas giant TotalEnergies celebrates 100 years in operation. ⁣⁣PriceofOil Africa Senior Campaigner Charity Migwi looks at the true cost of its legacy in Africa #linkinbio⁣⁣The company’s relentless pursuit of profit has come at the expense of Africa’s most vulnerable communities and irreplaceable ecosystems.⁣⁣Total has a foothold in nearly 130 countries and operations that encompass the entire spectrum of the fossil energy sector from exploration to production refining to distribution. ⁣⁣Yet it’s in Africa where TotalEnergies’ actions have left some of the deepest scars. ⁣⁣#StopDrillingStartPaying #StopEACOP

Times are tough. Greenpeace is under attack and with it the global environmental movement and the pillar of free speech itself. But we won’t back down. Protecting our common home cannot wait.Home is where we feel safe. For Indigenous peoples of the Amazon the forest is home. But in truth the Amazon is home to all of us—one of our planet’s life support systems.It holds 73 billion tons of carbon shielding us from climate chaos.When the Amazon thrives we all thrive. 🚨 Ice cream vs Big Oil…🍦 It’s getting REAL HOT out here. Under the scorching heat wave in Montreal Greenpeace Canada volunteers served out free vegan ice cream to help people cool down in the heat.Of course we had to name the flavours after Big Oil: dirty diesel drip gas guzzling twist climate crisis cream… 🤪 After all they’re the ones fuelling this crisis.In Canada nearly all provinces and one territory were under an extreme heat warning last week 🥵 Meanwhile people in Toronto experienced major floods and widespread power outages… ❤️‍🩹 Extreme weather events are no joke—they endanger our health and livelihoods. 🌡️To truly cool down we need to hold fossil fuel companies accountable and make them pay for making the planet increasingly unliveable. While you cool off with an ice cream today (either with us or at home!) take a minute to sign our petition asking Big Oil to pay into a #ClimateRecovery fund >> LINK IN BIO!💸 They fuel these disasters they pay.

🤔 How much does recovering from extreme weather disasters cost?⁣⁣Last year a massive flood in Libya claimed 4000 lives with 8000 people still missing 💔⁣⁣On top of the massive loss of life and destruction of families and livelihoods it will cost USD 1.8 BILLION to repair the damage caused.⁣⁣This is just one of many extreme storms experienced globally in the past year 🤯 yet fossil fuel companies who are driving the #climatecrisis do not pay a cent for the loss and damaged they’ve caused.⁣⁣Comment below if you fill big oil should be made to #PayUP 👇⁣⁣#StopDrillingStartPaying #MakePollutersPay

The reality of haze from forest fires may seem abstract to many. But to those in the front lines it’s a frightening reality. Many of us endure urban fog from pollution we complain about it and we are keenly aware of its detriment to our livelihoods. But here’s the difference: the haze in Porto Velho is the result of agribusiness practices running wild.You would think “How do they get away with it?!?!”. Well they have a financial lifeline 👀 Even those farms that get fined for deliberate fires still receive $12.5M in rural credit according to our research. 🤯 Somedo doesn’t even get fined ❗Join us in sending a message of #HopeForNature 📢 Click the link in our bio to learn more share Anders’ story and stop this #WorldOnFire 💪#DefundNatureDestruction 📽️ outcastfilm_ StudioBirthplace rob_natali

🥩 Big Meat and Dairy are heating up the planet 🌍🔥⁣⁣A few days ago Greenpeace activists from many countries paid a visit to some of the world’s biggest meat and dairy giants. These companies are major methane emitters accelerating climate chaos.⁣⁣Overproduction and overconsumption of meat and dairy are driving climate change polluting our soil air and water creating ocean dead zones and causing countless other problems.⁣⁣We can make a change! 💪 By putting the brakes on Big Meat and Dairy corporations curbing their destructive factory farms and making a massive switch to more plant-based diets wherever possible we can slow down global heating within this decade.⁣⁣Tap the link in our bio to join us!⁣⁣#Meat #Dairy #StopFactoryFarming #ClimateCrisis #Methane #MakeMethaneVisible #PlantBased #Greenpeace
Should fossil fuel corporations pay their fair share? Comment with your thoughts ⬇️⁣⁣#stormboris #stopdrillingstartpaying #PayUP

** Don’t let Big Oil silence the climate movement. Back Greenpeace now. **⁣⁣Around the world Big Oil is using lawsuits in an attempt to silence the climate movement. ⁣⁣Like Energy Transfer the company behind the Dakota Access Pipeline which is suing Greenpeace in the USA and Greenpeace International for US$300 million. It’s part of a concerted global attack by Big Oil which includes lawsuits from Big Oil corporations like ENI Shell and TotalEnergies. ⁣⁣We don’t think Big Oil should get to control the climate movement do you?⁣⁣⁣Back free speech. Back Greenpeace. Sign the open letter now.⁣We Will Not Be Silenced.⁣⁣Share with a friend who doesnt like bullies.⁣⁣#ImWithGreenpeace #StopDrillingStartPaying #WeWillNotBeSilenced ⁣

Where in the 🌏 is the Rainbow Warrior? 🌈⁣⁣Ahead of the final #PlasticsTreaty talks in Busan South Korea the iconic Greenpeace ship was in Taiwan to stand against a new petrochemical expansion! ⁣⁣⛵ That’s why greenpeace_tw joined forces with Mazu the powerful sea goddess to call on world leaders to support a Strong Global Plastics Treaty that drastically cuts production ⁣What must an effective treaty do? ⁣⁣✅ Protects biodiversity!⁣✅ Safeguards our climate!⁣✅ Ensures a just transition to a reuse-based economy! ⁣⁣Will you join the millions of others in this strong movement? ⁣⁣☝️Sign the petition in bio!⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#Plastics #BreakFreeFromPlastic #ClimateCrisis #FossilFuels #EndOil #plasticpollution #realsolutions #plasticfree #zerowaste #Reuse #Refill #INC5 #RainbowWarrior

We have bad news for corporate bullies like Energy Transfer: The European Union’s new anti-SLAPP Directive helps put an end to abusive legal tactics used to silence people who speak out on matters of public interest⁣⁣Check the link in our bio to learn how Greenpeace International’s fight against Energy Transfer’s meritless lawsuit is a landmark first-ever application of the European Union’s new anti-SLAPP directive. ⁣⁣#WeWillNotBeSilenced

Greenpeace International and Greenpeace entities in the US filed a petition to the North Dakota Supreme Court for a change of venue as they defend against the SLAPP case brought by Energy Transfer in Morton County North Dakota US.⁣⁣“The Greenpeace defendants have said from the start of this case that it should be heard away from where the events happened. After three motions for a venue change were refused we now feel compelled to ask the Supreme Court of North Dakota to relieve the local community from the burden of this case and ensure the fairness of the trial cannot be questioned” - Daniel Simons Senior Legal Counsel Greenpeace International.⁣⁣Check the link in our bio to learn more about Big Oil bully Energy Transfer’s SLAPP lawsuit.⁣⁣#WeWillNotBeSilenced

You may know Thailand as the country with good food and beautiful beaches but this country is also home to the Thai Mackerel an essential part of Thai cuisine and economy. This mighty fish has a multimillion dollar global demand but sadly overfishing and climate change are making its population die down. This June the Rainbow Warrior (Greenpeaceships) is sailing to Thailand to raise awareness about the threats facing the Thai oceans and to demand for a more urgent climate from the government.Stay tuned for more content on the Thai fishing industry and local coastal communities as the Rainbow Warrior goes on a ship tour around the country. And don’t forget to follow us and GreenpeaceTH for updates!#Thailand #Oceans #OceanJustice #RainbowWarrior #Mackerel

😥 Marginalised groups such as the LGBTQIA2S+ community are disproportionately impacted by the #climatecrisis. ⁣⁣Because of social stigma and lack of access to resources they are far less likely able to deal with climate impacts such as extreme weather events. ⁣⁣Here are 6 blogs explaining why there can be no #climatejustice without #queerjustice ➡️⁣⁣#AfricanPrideMonth #PrideOfAfrica

Global ocean management is broken. Since fisheries management organisations (RFMOs) first appeared 70 years ago they’ve repeatedly failed to protect the oceans. A new report from Greenpeace details how RFMOs have failed to meet their mandate for sustainably managing the impacts of fishing activity on biodiversity in international waters. ⁣.⁣The Global Ocean Treaty can deliver protection for all life in the global oceans. That’s why governments must step up and put their words into action. They must urgently ratify the Treaty and create global ocean sanctuaries.⁣⁣Go to the link in our bio to add your name to the petition and #ProtectTheOceans!

The fifth (and almost final) round of Global #PlasticsTreaty negotiations in Busan South Korea wrapped last week. No treaty was adopted and talks will extend into 2025. ⁣⁣This is a quick and dirty of what you missed 👇 ⁣⁣✅100+ countries stood up to the fossil fuel industry to reject a weak treaty. ⁣⁣✅4 brave Greenpeace International activists protested on a vessel carrying TOXIC plastic chemicals to call out petrochem production in the treaty. ⁣⁣✅1500+ allies marched for a strong treaty that cuts plastic production. ⁣⁣✅Almost 3 million signature petition delivered to world leaders. ⁣⁣✅1 urgent message for world leaders: We demand a treaty that cuts plastic production in 2025! ⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#Plastics #BreakFreeFromPlastic #ClimateCrisis #FossilFuels #EndOil #plasticpollution #realsolutions #plasticfree #zerowaste #Reuse #Refill #INC5⁣

Day 2 at the Fight for Alternatives Global Assembly in Manila: Youth Day! Youth activists from around the world are coming together to share workshop and brainstorm ideas for building a safe and just future with wellbeing at the core. We wanted to share some memorable quotes from Day 2’s speakers. 🇵🇭✊🌏1. Erick National Front for 40 Hours Mexico 🇲🇽“We need to be the owners of our present and our future and this is not only for the young people but for all the generations. We need to overcome taboos and prejudices. We need to raise awareness and empower our youth. The young people need to be aware of our society. The young people need to act. Rural areas are being marginalised opportunities are being taken away from the youth. We need to articulate the youth’s struggle more. We understand that this would take years of action and we need older people to help us. We need to ensure a future for us all.”2. Daisy from HAWI - Gender Equality and Inclusion Kenya 🇰🇪“For the youth we should conduct civic education. Educate them and let them know how to conduct advocacy practices on the issues that they have like unemployment and to hold politicians accountable. Guide them on which areas to go to which areas to learn from.”3. Sajida president of Sindhi Girls Student Tahreek Pakistan 🇵🇰“We have to empower the marginalised youth. We need to mobilise them unite them educate them about what is happening to us what are the actual problems and how can we overcome them. Without uniting and empowering them we cannot get any proper solutions we cannot get any progress.”

More than 50000 Pacific people are displaced every year due to climate and disaster-related events. ⁣⁣Climate crisis is real and is threatening the very survival of our Pacific nations!⁣⁣Heres where you get involved! Encourage the International Court of Justice the highest court in the world to give the climate crisis serious consideration by being on the right side of history and choose the protection of human rights! ⁣⁣Share this video 💙🙏⁣⁣⁣#ChangeTheLawChangeTheWorld #ClimateJusticeNow⁣

Human rights over bloody oil profits!⁣⁣This week five greenpeacenorge activists took peaceful action against Norwegian oil giant Equinor over its partnership with Ithaca Energy on the Rosebank oil field which is contributing to the illegal occupation of Palestine.⁣⁣Ithaca Energy is owned by Delek Group a company blacklisted by the UN for operating in Occupied Palestinian Territory. If Rosebank goes ahead profits from the oil field will contribute to the financing and expansion of illegal Israeli settlements on Palestinian land.⁣⁣The activists occupied the company’s offices in Oslo for nine hours supported by a peaceful demo outside.⁣⁣Thousands of people have raised their voice against equinor’s contribution to the bloody and illegal occupation. We call on the Norwegian government Equinor’s majority-owner to ensure that Equinor respects human rights and international law. ⁣⁣Equinor must end the relationship with Ithaca and cancel Rosebank. Sign the petition now via link in bio greenpeace⁣⁣#equinorout #stoprosebank⁣

Switching from Putin’s gas to Trump’s fracked gas doesn’t solve Europe’s energy needs—it only deepens our dependence on harmful fossil fuels. Fracked gas from the U.S. can be even worse for the climate than coal and it comes with serious safety and health risks.⁣⁣Instead of keeping Europe hooked on fossil fuels the EU must lead the way into the renewable energy future ensuring fair energy prices and real energy security.⁣⁣Sign our open letter and demand a ban on all new fossil fuel projects. Let’s invest in renewables reduce gas consumption and protect people and our planet.⁣⁣✍️ Join us in signing our open letter demanding the EU stop fossil gas projects and protect our health and planet. ⁣⁣➡️ act.gp/stopfossilfuels  #StopFossilGas

This past weekend greenpeace.southasia unfurled an exciting banner in the heart of Colombo to celebrate the commitment of the leadership of South Asian countries to #ProtectTheOceans.⁣Recently Sri Lankas Cabinet of Ministers approved signing of the High Seas Treaty marking another milestone in the journey to get the Treaty ratified across the globe. Bangladesh and Maldives have already ratified the Treaty while India and Nepal have signed it.⁣This shows commitment to creating waves of change for ocean protection in South Asia. Let’s continue the fight and ensure a sustainable future for all marine life!⁣#OceanProtection #MarineProtection #OceansForAll #HighSeasTreaty #SouthAsia #ClimateCrisis

We’ve made so many major advances in technology over the years yet our smartphones and other gadgets are still manufactured with electricity from polluting fossil fuels?!😅😟⁣.⁣In a recent study by Greenpeace East Asia and cityuhongkong it found that over 218 million tonnes more emissions would be generated in 2030 if major manufacturers fail to achieve 100% renewable energy by then. That’s more than the total emissions of the Netherlands!⁣.⁣Flooding storms and heatwaves are getting worse. As we all strive to save the planet its time for companies like Samsung UMC and Luxshare Precision to take responsibility and pledge to achieve 100% renewable energy by 2030.⁣.⁣Join us to urge these companies to make the right choice and sign the petition in the link in bio. ⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#SupplyChange

The government of Porto Alegre (Brazil) didn’t budget for flood protection and now the city is facing its biggest disaster in history..What if the budget had been made by the people as it used to be?In less than a year the region of Rio Grande do Sul has faced four major floods affecting millions of people. And when we look back we see that the policies needed to prevent adapt and respond to extreme events were left out of the plans.Participatory democracy which was once a reality in #PortoAlegre and an example to the world is all about ensuring that everyone has a voice in the management of resources directing them where they really matter. It’s not just about coping with extreme events but also about defining policies that contribute to a fairer and more sustainable future so that people no longer live under a constant sense of fear and uncertainty. Change is possible and we can demand it. Join the fight for climate justice.📸: Vitor Rosa. Em menos de um ano o Rio Grande do Sul enfrentou quatro grandes enchentes afetando milhões de pessoas. E quando olhamos para trás vemos que as políticas necessárias para prevenção adaptação e resposta aos eventos extremos ficaram fora dos planos. A pergunta que ecoa é: e se as pessoas tivessem sido incluídas nas decisões do orçamento municipal? Será que a história seria diferente? A democracia participativa que já foi uma realidade em Porto Alegre e exemplo para o mundo busca exatamente isso: garantir que todos tenham espaço de voz na gestão dos recursos direcionando-os para onde realmente importa. Não é apenas sobre enfrentar eventos extremos mas também sobre definir políticas que contribuam para um futuro mais justo e sustentável que faça com que as pessoas deixem de viver sob uma sensação constante de medo e . A mudança é possível e a sociedade pode cobrar por isso. Some a sua voz à luta pela proteção ambiental.

The global fishing industry is a complex system of grocery stores seafood companies and fishing vessels that feels incredibly distant to most of us.⁣⁣But at the other end of the convoluted supply chain is another human being. ⁣⁣A person with hopes dreams a family friends...and according to mounting reports a person being exploited in order to provide seafood to supermarkets and restaurants worldwide. ⁣⁣Follow Firmans* journey from Indonesia to the Indian Ocean and the tuna he caught from ocean to plate.⁣⁣(*not his real name)⁣🎨: vireeys ⁣#ProtectOceansProtectWorkers⁣#EndModernSlaveryatSEA⁣#StopIUUFishing

📣 Are you following our coverage of #COP16? The most important conference on biodiversity is happening now in Cali Colombia 🇨🇴 where representatives from countries from all over the world are meeting to discuss the future of nature.⁣⁣Stay tuned on our channels to know what is at stake and what you can do to demand your local government take take serious to protect our planet 🌎⁣⁣#COP16Colombia #GPCOP16 #GreenpeaceCOP16

UN Biodiversity #COP16 is underway in Cali Colombia! In its first week delegates from 196 countries addressed several key issues for biodiversity and now at the halfway point we tell you whether the path so far is GREEN YELLOW or RED.⁣⁣🔹 Among the issues the first week were countries action plans to protect 30% of their ecosystems financing for nature protection the synergy between climate urgency issues and efforts to conserve biodiversity ahead of the upcoming Climate COP and citizen participation. But #Cali also became the heart of the “#COP of the People” with the #GreenZone where forums and cultural activities are held reflecting the natural and cultural diversity of the region 🎶.⁣⁣⁣Go to the link in our bio to know more about our demands to global leaders at COP16!

They didn’t see THIS coming… 👀⁣⁣This week Greenpeace UK took the climate crisis to Shell’s front door.⁣⁣Activists surrounded the oil giant’s doorstep with once-cherished belongings which were wrecked when typhoons struck the Philippines.⁣⁣Ordinary people in the Philippines and beyond shouldn’t be the ones paying to repair damage caused by the climate crisis when they did the least to cause it⁣⁣Big Oil companies who are making billions by fuelling climate change should be the ones footing the bill.⁣⁣Take action now to demand that Big Oil giants are made to pay for their climate damage - sign our huge people-powered petition.⁣⁣#Philippines #Typhoon #ClimateCrisis #ClimateChange #Shell #MakeShellPay #StopDrillingStartPaying⁣

See you in court!🏛️💥✊⁣⁣Today a Dutch court ruled that Greenpeace Netherlands can proceed with their climate case against the Dutch State. In this climate lawsuit Greenpeace Netherlands is working together with the people of Dutch-Caribbean island Bonaire who are already facing the consequences of the climate crisis. Flooding and extreme heat impact peoples houses jobs and health yet the Dutch government has not done enough to protect them. ⁣⁣The case is now moving forward and it is high time! ⁣⁣The recently installed Dutch cabinet is scaling back on climate policy. That’s why Greenpeace Netherlands and people of Bonaire are demanding the Dutch State to comply with its international commitments and human rights obligations by reducing CO2 emissions much faster and protecting citizens on Bonaire. ⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#climatejustice #bonaire

Deforestation in Kenya isn’t just about trees—it’s about water food and climate stability.⁣⁣The destruction of Karura Suam Oloolua Mau and Aberdare forests will harm us all.⁣⁣Critical ecosystems in Kenya are at risk from development and illegal logging.⁣⁣Join in protecting  these forests by signing the petition on  greenpeaceafricas bio. ⁣.⁣.⁣#HandsOffOurForests

We need your help!⁣⁣Our activists - Al Ash Jens Sam and Rainbow Warrior Captain Hettie - are currently prohibited from leaving South Korea. They are under an ongoing investigation for the peaceful direct action that took place in Daesen city as a part of the ‘Zero Plastic Tour’ Rainbow Warrior ship tour in East Asia.⁣⁣ICYMI: On 30 November the 4 activists boarded a tanker that was about to load toxic plastic chemicals from South Korea’s Hyundai Daesan Refinery complex to deliver a strong message to cut plastic pollution to the world leaders gathered at the nearby city of Busan for the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (#INC5) to negotiate a UN Global Plastics Treaty. ⁣⁣Help us request for the legal processes to be completed quickly so our activists - #INC5Warriors - can rejoin their loved ones as soon as possible! Your signature will be delivered to the prosecutor and the judge overseeing our ongoing case in South Korea. ⁣⁣We’re grateful for each and every one of your support.⁣⁣Add your name via link in bio.⁣⁣#Greenpeace

Strategic Lawsuits Against Public Participation (SLAPPs) are lawsuits that are filed with the intent to censor intimidate or silence critics by burdening them with the cost of a legal defence until they abandon their criticism or opposition. ⁣⁣For corporate bullies like Energy Transfer and Shell SLAPP lawsuits are about outspending opponents to intimidate them into silence. For Indigenous Peoples NGOs like Greenpeace International and class action communities fighting such SLAPP suits is about movement building in opposition to colonialist domineering and arrogant companies and their destructive projects whether in the energy sector agribusiness mining chemicals forestry etc.⁣⁣#WeWillNotBeSilenced ⁣⁣Check the link in or bio to learn more about about the global battle against SLAPPs and to share a message of solidarity 💚🌎

Who will draft this #PlasticsTreaty: 🛢️Big Oil or 🌏World Leaders?🚨🚨 A SHOCKING ciel_org report just revealed a record number of 220 fossil fuel and chemical industry lobbyists have registered participants at the final critical UN negotiations for a Global Plastics Treaty in Busan South Korea more than 196 during INC4.THIS IS WHY 👉Plastic is Big 🤑🤑🤑for the fossil fuel industry! They’re scared of losing profit and we can’t let them win!Plastic production could triple by 2050 unless world leaders deliver a strong treaty that cuts production.THIS IS OUR LAST CHANCE!We need world leaders to step up for people and planet and reject all fossil fuel industry interference in the final days of this treaty session if we are to deliver a strong treaty that ends the age of plastic!Share and tag your world leader to cut plastic production not the treaty’s ambition!...#Plastics #BreakFreeFromPlastic #ClimateCrisis #FossilFuels #EndOil #plasticpollution #realsolutions #plasticfree #zerowaste #Reuse #Refill #INC5

Eight plaintiffs from the Dutch-Caribbean island of Bonaire together with Greenpeace Netherlands have provided new evidence to the Court for their climate case against the Dutch State. New research shows that the Netherlands CO2 emissions can be brought to zero 10 years earlier than currently planned (2040) (Details on https://act.gp/42TcZL6) People in Bonaire are not sufficiently protected in the climate crisis and the Netherlands CO2 emissions must and can be reduced faster to prevent the worst climate disasters.Show your support to the people of Bonaire 👉 https://act.gp/3ESeDCu...#ClimateCase #Bonaire #ClimateJustice

Greenpeace Will Not Back Down! 🌏✊A major fossil fuel corporation is using a SLAPP lawsuit (Strategic Lawsuit Against Public Participation) to sue Greenpeace for over USD$660 million to pressure and silence environmental movements worldwide. This is an attack on freedom of expression and protest—fundamental human rights.🔥 But we will not give up!We will continue to speak the truth challenge the power that violates human rights and the environment and stand in solidarity with Greenpeace International and Greenpeace USA. We will not allow oil and gas corporations to use the law as a weapon to intimidate and destroy the fight for climate justice!This is not just Greenpeace’s fight—it’s a fight for all of us. We call on fossil fuel corporations to stop attacking environmental defenders. Businesses must respect human rights and environmental rights.📣Share this post! Make your voice heard! Because the future of our planet depends on all of us!#WeWillNotBeSilenced #lawsuit #environment #sustainability #protest

INTRODUCING: the new and definitely-not-evil chatbot from Big Oil. ⁣⁣Since Big Oil wants to control what the climate movement can and can’t say we asked it a few questions. ⁣⁣Ok we’re joking. But Big Oil isn’t. Around the world Big Oil is trying to censor environmental movements with lawsuits that bankrupt activists into silence.⁣Lawsuits like the one Energy Transfer is currently taking out against Greenpeace International and Greenpeace in the USA for US$300 million.⁣⁣That’s barely enough to make a dent in Energy Transfer’s US$80 billion revenue. For us it’s an attack that could threaten the future of Greenpeace in the USA. ⁣⁣We don’t think that Big Oil has any business telling us what we are allowed to say. Do you?⁣⁣Back free speech. Back Greenpeace. Sign the open letter now.⁣We Will Not Be Silenced.⁣⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣.⁣#ImWithGreenpeace #StopDrillingStartPaying #WeWillNotBeSilenced

Clean air is a human right. We deserve to live in a world where the air we breathe is not poisoning us and we deserve world leaders who take our health and well-being seriously. 🍃⁣⁣The World Health Organization estimates that around 7 million premature deaths in 2023 were caused by air pollution and if we dont drastically reduce our carbon emissions soon this number is bound to get even higher.⁣⁣We need #CleanAirNow. ⁣⁣

This joyful snow day video you’re watching was filmed back in November during #INC5 in South Korea just days before our activists were detained then suspended from leaving the country for conducting a peaceful protest.⁣⁣ICYMI: On 30 November Al Ash Jens and Sam boarded a tanker that was about to load toxic plastic chemicals from South Korea’s Hyundai Daesan Refinery complex. ⁣⁣As a part of the ‘Zero Plastic Tour’ Rainbow Warrior ship tour in East Asia they were delivering a strong message to cut plastic pollution to the world leaders gathered at the nearby city of Busan for the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (#INC5) to negotiate a UN Global Plastics Treaty.⁣⁣And fast forward almost 2 months later the 4 activists and Rainbow Warrior Captain Hettie are still under an ongoing investigation for the peaceful direct action.⁣⁣With the follow-up negotiation meeting for the Global Plastics Treaty expected to be announced soon we are asking for your help for a quick conclusion of the investigation so our activists - our #INC5Warriors - can be reunited with their loved ones back home. ⁣⁣Add your name to our petition. ⁣⁣#Greenpeace

What if wealthy nations took responsibility for their own consumption and energy needs—instead of dumping the social and environmental costs on the Global South?Today is #WorldDayOfSocialJustice and greenpeacear and MENAFem Movement for Economic Development and Ecological Justice are launching a report that challenges the common narrative around European investments in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region. While these investments are often portrayed as mutually beneficial the reality is that they reinforce Europes exploitation of the Global South with harmful economic and environmental impacts on our communities.We must demand an end to harmful projects and together we can stop neo-colonialism in its tracks. Its time to stop the exploitation and stay united for a future that respects people and the planet.#europe #MENA #middleeast #northafrica #neocolonialism #energy #agriculture #bigoil #bigag #majorityworld
